title: WHIRLING F1 / GARTE MAIN
description: This is Garte's main dialogue for the rest of the game

dialogueTree.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Is there something I can do for yo..."
dialogueTree.text: "Is there something I can do for you?"

links.title: Cuno: ""You still haven't drawn Cuno a lin..."
links.text: "You still haven't drawn Cuno a line, the fuck's up with that?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "He doesn't say what's up with that."
links.text: He doesn't say what's up with that.

links.title: Cuno: ""I'll have a big fat one, bartender.""
links.text: "I'll have a big fat one, bartender."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "He doesn't take the bait."
links.text: He doesn't take the bait.

links.title: Cuno: ""You can get that big shiny fucking..."
links.text: "You can get that big shiny fucking plate..." He points at something. "...and draw Cuno a line."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "He keeps his eyes on you, ignoring..."
links.text: He keeps his eyes on you, ignoring the boy.

links.title: Volition: "He's used to this sort of thing."
links.text: He's used to this sort of thing.

links.title: You: ""Hey, has a package been delivered..."
links.text: "Hey, has a package been delivered for me?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "His brow furrows in confusion. "You..."
links.text: His brow furrows in confusion. "You're expecting a package? To arrive for you here?"

links.title: You: ""I guess it hasn't come then?""
links.text: "I guess it hasn't come then?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""No, it hasn't. I'll let you know i..."
links.text: "No, it hasn't. I'll let you know if anything arrives for you. Anything else?"

links.title: You: ""Yeah, Speedfreaks FM said they mig..."
links.text: "Yeah, Speedfreaks FM said they might send me something."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Speedfreaks FM? I -- no, you don't..."
links.text: "Speedfreaks FM? I -- no, you don't have any packages waiting for you here. Anything else?"

links.title: You: ""What about now, is my package here..."
links.text: "What about now, is my package here yet?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""No, your package isn't here yet,"..."
links.text: "No, your package isn't here yet," he says with undisguised disdain. "I told you I'd let you know."

links.title: You: ""I know you said you'd let me know..."
links.text: "I know you said you'd let me know about the package, but -- what about now?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""I'm not dignifying that with a res..."
links.text: "I'm not dignifying that with a response."

links.title: Rhetoric: "Too late. You just did."
links.text: Too late. You just did.

links.title: You: ""But you just did. Right there.""
links.text: "But you just did. Right there."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "The man actually remains silent thi..."
links.text: The man actually remains silent this time. He looks at you expectantly.

links.title: You: ""Fair enough.""
links.text: "Fair enough."

links.title: You: ""Package?""
links.text: "Package?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "He refuses to reply. Only his breat..."
links.text: He refuses to reply. Only his breathing quickens with badly-concealed irritation.

links.title: You: ""Did a package from Speedfreaks FM..."
links.text: "Did a package from Speedfreaks FM come for me?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "His eyes go wide with recognition...."
links.text: His eyes go wide with recognition. "Oh my god, the package -- I forgot, yes, yes it did arrive, when you were..." He stops, unsure how to continue.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "He searches underneath the counter...."
links.text: He searches underneath the counter. After a moment, he produces a pair of neon sneakers, packaged in a plastic bag. A postage label directs it to the Whirling-in-Rags, to the 'Wildest Cop in Revachol'.

links.title: Cuno: ""The fuck?" pipes the boy. "Pig's s..."
links.text: "The fuck?" pipes the boy. "Pig's selling out for Speedfreaks FM now?"

links.title: You: ""I wish Kim could have been here. H..."
links.text: "I wish Kim could have been here. He really liked these guys."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "His face moves between a sympatheti..."
links.text: His face moves between a sympathetic smile and a sincere frown. Unsure what to do, he covers his mouth with his hand and pretends to cough.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "After a moment, he speaks. "Maybe y..."
links.text: After a moment, he speaks. "Maybe you could send the shoes to him? In the hospital. Maybe it'd cheer him up. Do you know where he is?"

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "The lieutenant lies in recovery. Wh..."
links.text: The lieutenant lies in recovery. Where he does so, however, is unknown.

links.title: You: ""I... I don't know what hospital he..."
links.text: "I... I don't know what hospital he's in. I don't know where Kim is."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Right..." He looks pained on your..."
links.text: "Right..." He looks pained on your behalf. "I'll tell you what. I'll find out if you like, and can send them on to him. What do you think?"

links.title: You: ""Sounds good. Send it to Kim.""
links.text: "Sounds good. Send it to Kim."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Happy to help, officer. Anything e..."
links.text: "Happy to help, officer. Anything else I can help you with?" He puts the package back under the counter.

links.title: You: ""Yeah. Totally. I totally know. Of..."
links.text: "Yeah. Totally. I totally know. Of course."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "He looks pained on your behalf."
links.text: He looks pained on your behalf.

links.title: Drama: "Your liessss, sire! He seesss throu..."
links.text: Your liessss, sire! He seesss through them with a dissscerning eye of truth!

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Right... I'll tell you what. I'll..."
links.text: "Right... I'll tell you what. I'll find out if you like, and can send them on to him. What do you think?"

links.title: You: ""Thanks, Garte." (Take the shoes.)"
links.text: "Thanks, Garte." (Take the shoes.)

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "He nods. "Happy to help, officer.""
links.text: He nods. "Happy to help, officer."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""They actually did it..." The lieut..."
links.text: "They actually did it..." The lieutenant stares in amazement at the package.

links.title: You: ""Jealous, Kim?""
links.text: "Jealous, Kim?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It's not something I'd wear on the..."
links.text: "It's not something I'd wear on the job." He smiles slightly.

links.title: You: ""Good. Because it's finders keepers..."
links.text: "Good. Because it's finders keepers, sucker."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Fair enough. Now if we're finished..."
links.text: "Fair enough. Now if we're finished discussing this, can we return to solving the murder?" He struggles to keep his smile.

links.title: You: ""Sounds good!" (Take the shoes.)"
links.text: "Sounds good!" (Take the shoes.)

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Anything else I can do for you, of..."
links.text: "Anything else I can do for you, officers?" The man smiles at you both.

links.title: You: ""I'm sorry, Kim. You can have them..."
links.text: "I'm sorry, Kim. You can have them if you want."

links.title: You: ""You can have them if you want, Kim.""
links.text: "You can have them if you want, Kim."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "A thought flickers in his eyes, and..."
links.text: A thought flickers in his eyes, and is then extinguished. He shakes his head. "Keep them, detective. You earned it."

links.title: You: ""You sure? Seriously, you can have..."
links.text: "You sure? Seriously, you can have them if you want."

links.text: "I am sure," he says, smiling at the plastic-wrapped shoes in their neon glory.

links.text: "But this establishment only takes cash. Now, do you have that cash, Mr. Novelty Cheque Man?"

links.text: "This is a *culinary* establishment, not a morgue -- you don't have to ask me *why* you can't store a dead body in my kitchen."

links.title: Logic: "Hmm... kitchen. It's right nearby...."
links.text: Hmm... kitchen. It's right nearby. What if you asked the cook?

links.title: You: ""Yeah. We've heard you have, like,..."
links.text: "Yeah. We've heard you have, like, a *huge* fridge. Colossal. Practically a mausoleum."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""You've heard wrong. And you're *no..."
links.text: "You've heard wrong. And you're *not* putting a dead body into my fridge."

links.title: Suggestion: "Damn, I thought the size thing woul..."
links.text: Damn, I thought the size thing would work...

links.title: You: ""No. We want to put a *very importa..."
links.text: "No. We want to put a *very important* dead body into your fridge."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""I don't care. You're not putting a..."
links.text: "I don't care. You're not putting a dead body into my fridge."

links.title: You: ""Yes. That's the gist of it.""
links.text: "Yes. That's the gist of it."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Well -- I *have* a fridge and you'..."
links.text: "Well -- I *have* a fridge and you're not putting it here."

links.title: You: ""How did you know?""
links.text: "How did you know?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Because you haven't taken it away..."
links.text: "Because you haven't taken it away yet, and it must be stinking *hard* about now. Well -- you're not putting it here. Rest assured."

links.title: Suggestion: "Flattery is the way."
links.text: Flattery is the way.

links.title: You: ""Where did everyone go?""
links.text: "Where did everyone go?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Oh, you know..." he looks around a..."
links.text: "Oh, you know..." he looks around at the empty place. "People don't tend to stick around after shoot-outs. Turns out they're not good for business."

links.title: You: ""Are Lena and Morell still in town?""
links.text: "Are Lena and Morell still in town?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Ah, them! Nice people -- but no. L..."
links.text: "Ah, them! Nice people -- but no. Lena said they were going back to Jamrock. I saw them pass by, outside." He waves at the windows. "This was *before* the fight started."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""I'm glad she got out of here befor..."
links.text: "I'm glad she got out of here before all that. Bullets flying and stuff... people inside were quite terrified you know. I had to take action and step outside too..."

links.title: You: ""Okay. Yes. That was for the best.""
links.text: "Okay. Yes. That was for the best."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "He nods. "Yes. You know. And I went..."
links.text: He nods. "Yes. You know. And I went outside and took care of it. Everybody calmed down. Felt like the right thing to do."

links.title: Rhetoric: "He's almost completely forgotten wh..."
links.text: He's almost completely forgotten what this began with.

links.title: You: ""But we weren't done looking for th..."
links.text: "But we weren't done looking for the phasmid..."

links.title: You: ""But we weren't done looking for th..."
links.text: "But we weren't done looking for the phasmid..."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""I mean, you're a detective, perhap..."
links.text: "I mean, you're a detective, perhaps you can track them down? Shouldn't be that hard..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Exactly --" He looks at you. "But..."
links.text: "Exactly --" He looks at you. "But all in due time. Crypto-business is not a priority right now."

links.title: Inland Empire: "You'll see her again one day. You k..."
links.text: You'll see her again one day. You know it. Things went like they did for a reason.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "Seeing the disappointment in your f..."
links.text: Seeing the disappointment in your face, he relents. "Oh, fine, hero-cop. Lena left a forwarding address. 1113 Tabernacle Road, in Jamrock. If you see them again... do give them my best."

links.title: Cuno: ""Yeah, Cuno doesn't know what the f..."
links.text: "Yeah, Cuno doesn't know what the fuck this is about, but you should chill down, pig. You'll get this Lena fuck. On false charges." He nods confidently.

links.title: You: ""What happened to the man with the..."
links.text: "What happened to the man with the sunglasses?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""I don't remember *everyone* who co..."
links.text: "I don't remember *everyone* who comes here." He shakes his head. "And -- many people wear sunglasses inside lately. Must be a fad."

links.title: You: ""Okay, so I have to mention -- when..."
links.text: "Okay, so I have to mention -- when it happened, *you* were right out there. On the balcony."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Yeah, I was, yeah." He nods. Tryin..."
links.text: "Yeah, I was, yeah." He nods. Trying to remain aloof. "That's because I'm a *bad ass*."

links.title: Suggestion: "It really took courage. Don't pick..."
links.text: It really took courage. Don't pick at him.

links.title: You: ""Yeah, I guess you are a bad ass.""
links.text: "Yeah, I guess you are a bad ass."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Yeah, I don't know..." He feels th..."
links.text: "Yeah, I don't know..." He feels the need to explain himself. "Clients were panicking. And also, I guess I sort of found out that I don't give a shit if I die."

links.title: Empathy: "He means it. It's not just boasting..."
links.text: He means it. It's not just boasting. It's something he discovered about himself, stepping onto that balcony.

links.title: You: ""If you say it as two different wor..."
links.text: "If you say it as two different words like that, it sounds like there's something wrong with your ass."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Yeah, well..." He scoffs. "Fuck yo..."
links.text: "Yeah, well..." He scoffs. "Fuck you too then. You have any more questions, or stylistic pronunciation advice?"

links.title: Empathy: "He's not too offended. The experien..."
links.text: He's not too offended. The experience has changed something in him.

links.title: You: "Just nod -- *stoically*."
links.text: Just nod -- *stoically*.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "He nods back at you -- even more st..."
links.text: He nods back at you -- even more stoically.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "Just two bad ass men nodding, stoic..."
links.text: Just two bad ass men nodding, stoically.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "Make that three. The lieutenant is..."
links.text: Make that three. The lieutenant is nodding too, hands crossed.

links.title: Cuno: "Make that three. Cuno is nodding to..."
links.text: Make that three. Cuno is nodding too, hands crossed.

links.title: You: ""By the way -- where were you when..."
links.text: "By the way -- where were you when it happened?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Where was *I*? How do you think I..."
links.text: "Where was *I*? How do you think I know the crazy shit you pulled off out there? I was *there* -- out on the balcony, protecting my establishment."

links.title: Reaction Speed: "That's actually true. You remember..."
links.text: That's actually true. You remember him, from the corner of your eye, right behind you on the Whirling balcony...

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""So yeah." He looks around, aloof...."
links.text: "So yeah." He looks around, aloof. "I guess I'm what you call a bad ass."

links.title: You: ""All right. Thanks." (Conclude.)"
links.text: "All right. Thanks." (Conclude.)

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""No problem." He looks around at th..."
links.text: "No problem." He looks around at the empty establishment. "They'll come back. They always do."

links.title: You: ""Is the trash container out back yo..."
links.text: "Is the trash container out back yours?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Mine? No, it belongs to the Whirli..."
links.text: "Mine? No, it belongs to the Whirling-in-Rags."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Thank you for clearing that up. Wh..."
links.text: "Thank you for clearing that up. Why do you keep the container locked?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Why? To keep the hobos and drunks..."
links.text: "Why? To keep the hobos and drunks out, that's why. And the neighbours too. They put their trash there and they don't pay for the garbage company."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I thought as much -- and are you t..."
links.text: "I thought as much -- and are you the only party with access to the trash container?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Well, yes, us and the garbage disp..."
links.text: "Well, yes, us and the garbage disposal company."

links.title: Rhetoric: "It seems a little *callous*, doesn'..."
links.text: It seems a little *callous*, doesn't it? Something stirs in you...

links.title: You: "I wonder what this feeling is?"
links.text: I wonder what this feeling is?

links.title: Rhetoric: "Prod at him and find out!"
links.text: Prod at him and find out!

links.title: You: "No, it doesn't. Nothing stirs in me..."
links.text: No, it doesn't. Nothing stirs in me, and it isn't callous, it's common sense.

links.title: Rhetoric: "Okay then. (Maybe you're callous yo..."
links.text: Okay then. (Maybe you're callous yourself...)

links.title: You: ""What if I told you *I* am a hobo...."
links.text: "What if I told you *I* am a hobo. Or soon to be one, rummaging through that trash. Will you keep me out too?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Yes.""
links.text: "Yes."

links.title: You: ""But I need those leftovers to surv..."
links.text: "But I need those leftovers to survive!"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Sir, I'm sorry the RCM is having f..."
links.text: "Sir, I'm sorry the RCM is having financial trouble, but it's not this establishment's problem."

links.title: You: ""Good call. So would I. Teach a man..."
links.text: "Good call. So would I. Teach a man to fish."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""I'm not a fishing-teacher." He spr..."
links.text: "I'm not a fishing-teacher." He spreads his hands. "That is not why we keep our trash locked. Any place with a kitchen does it, it's not *political*, I assure you."

links.title: Rhetoric: "Everything is political."
links.text: Everything is political.

links.title: You: "Say nothing."
links.text: Say nothing.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "He stares at you, beady-eyed..."
links.text: He stares at you, beady-eyed...

links.title: You: ""Everything is political.""
links.text: "Everything is political."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Fine. Was there something you want..."
links.text: "Fine. Was there something you wanted?"

links.title: You: ""Doesn't it seem callous to you --..."
links.text: "Doesn't it seem callous to you -- guarding even your *leftovers* from the poor?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""*Callous*? What are you, Kras Mazo..."
links.text: "*Callous*? What are you, Kras Mazov? Almost all establishments in Revachol keep their trash locked. The Whirling-in-Rags is not special in that regard."

links.title: You: "Yum yum, tell me more."
links.text: Yum yum, tell me more.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "He killed himself."
links.text: He killed himself.

links.title: You: ""Maybe I *am* Kras Mazov?""
links.text: "Maybe I *am* Kras Mazov?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""What are we talking about? Was thi..."
links.text: "What are we talking about? Was this not about the trash container?"

links.title: You: ""No wait..." (Whisper and point to..."
links.text: "No wait..." (Whisper and point to the back of your head.) "What if I *am* Kras Mazov."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We should return to the case of yo..."
links.text: "We should return to the case of your *mistaken identity* at a later time, officer. This was about the *trash container*."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We should return to this theory at..."
links.text: "We should return to this theory at a later time, officer. This here was about the *trash container*."

links.title: You: ""Yes, let's return to that.""
links.text: "Yes, let's return to that."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Was there something you *wanted*?""
links.text: "Was there something you *wanted*?"

links.title: You: ""I'm no Kras Mazov.""
links.text: "I'm no Kras Mazov."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No one was implying you were, offi..."
links.text: "No one was implying you were, officer. Where were we?"

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Kras Mazov (nom de guerre), was an..."
links.text: Kras Mazov (nom de guerre), was an economist and a historical materialist. He was a leading figure on the Graad side of the Centennial Revolution, where he headed the Eleven Day Government. Mazov is considered the father of scientific communism (Mazovian thought or Mazovianism).

links.title: You: ""We need those keys.""
links.text: "We need those keys."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""What do you need them for?""
links.text: "What do you need them for?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It concerns the case." The lieuten..."
links.text: "It concerns the case." The lieutenant's voice is harsh and sudden. "Please cooperate."

links.title: You: ""Don't get smart with me.""
links.text: "Don't get smart with me."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""I was merely clearing up the diffe..."
links.text: "I was merely clearing up the difference. What did you want with it?"

links.title: You: ""I need the keys to the container.""
links.text: "I need the keys to the container."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""May I ask why?""
links.text: "May I ask why?"

links.title: You: ""It's part of the case. There may b..."
links.text: "It's part of the case. There may be evidence in there."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "He takes the keys from under the co..."
links.text: He takes the keys from under the counter and hands them to you: "Just bring them back once you're done, please."

links.title: You: ""I'm the police. That's why. Give m..."
links.text: "I'm the police. That's why. Give me the keys."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "He looks at you with his head tilte..."
links.text: He looks at you with his head tilted and his brow furrowed: "Fine."

links.title: You: ""It's a personal matter.""
links.text: "It's a personal matter."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""If it's a personal matter, why in..."
links.text: "If it's a personal matter, why in the name of god should I..." He stops mid-sentence. "Okay, whatever."

links.title: You: ""I had a *premonition*. And *omen*..."
links.text: "I had a *premonition*. And *omen* even. Call it what you want... I need to see what's in that container."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""An omen?" He looks at you, his nec..."
links.text: "An omen?" He looks at you, his neck crooked and his brow furrowed, then says shakes his head: "Whatever..."

links.title: You: ""That's it. There was something els..."
links.text: "That's it. There was something else I wanted."

links.title: You: ""Did you see the HUGE graffito outs..."
links.text: "Did you see the HUGE graffito outside?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""No, I *completely* failed to notic..."
links.text: "No, I *completely* failed to notice that. It's only in front of the entrance to the establishment I manage. Though, maybe," he continues reluctantly, "it's still better than just the blood."

links.title: You: ""Do you think it's connected to The..."
links.text: "Do you think it's connected to The Return?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "He rolls his eyes. "The Return of w..."
links.text: He rolls his eyes. "The Return of what? Some commie bullshit? The Return of the king? I don't concern myself with paranoid political rumours. I have a *real* place to run."

links.title: You: ""Did you see the HUGE BURNING graff..."
links.text: "Did you see the HUGE BURNING graffito outside?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Yes. Very *responsible*.""
links.text: "Yes. Very *responsible*."

links.title: You: ""C'mon, you've gotta admit -- it wa..."
links.text: "C'mon, you've gotta admit -- it was pretty cool."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Looked pretty hot to me..." He sto..."
links.text: "Looked pretty hot to me..." He stops, realizing that this is also a compliment. "At least nothing bad actually happened," he adds with a sigh.

links.title: Endurance: "He's so exhausted following recent..."
links.text: He's so exhausted following recent events, he doesn't even have the energy to really get on your case.

links.title: You: ""The end has begun.""
links.text: "The end has begun."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Sure. I don't know. Maybe. Maybe *..."
links.text: "Sure. I don't know. Maybe. Maybe *the end* has begun? Fuck it." He sighs, more tired than angry.

links.title: You: ""I guess you're right, it was prett..."
links.text: "I guess you're right, it was pretty irresponsible of me."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Yes, well..." He sighs. "At least..."
links.text: "Yes, well..." He sighs. "At least nothing bad happened -- yet."

links.title: You: ""Don't worry. The fire will go out..."
links.text: "Don't worry. The fire will go out -- soon."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Mhm. *Before* it reaches the Whirl..."
links.text: "Mhm. *Before* it reaches the Whirling, hopefully..." He sighs, more tired than angry.

links.title: You: ""Here's your trash container key.""
links.text: "Here's your trash container key."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "He stares at the key before him on..."
links.text: He stares at the key before him on the counter, then up at you.

links.title: Composure: "He looks pale. Nauseous. He's guilt..."
links.text: He looks pale. Nauseous. He's guilty. But not enough to apologize...

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "Wordlessly, he places it back under..."
links.text: Wordlessly, he places it back under the desk.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Thank you..." He stares at the key..."
links.text: "Thank you..." He stares at the key before him on the counter, then up at you.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""And... I'm sorry about the other n..."
links.text: "And... I'm sorry about the other night. I'm sorry I told you to sleep in the trash. That was wrong of me."

links.title: Empathy: "Okay. This is a good chance to star..."
links.text: Okay. This is a good chance to start fresh. Just forgive him -- see how it goes.

links.title: Half Light: "NO, FUCK HIM. HE TREATED YOU LIKE G..."
links.text: NO, FUCK HIM. HE TREATED YOU LIKE GODDAMN HUMAN WASTE.

links.title: You: ""Apology accepted.""
links.text: "Apology accepted."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "He smiles. It's a moment before he..."
links.text: He smiles. It's a moment before he puts the key back under the counter. "Anything else I can do for you, then?"

links.title: Empathy: "See? That meant a lot to him. Felt..."
links.text: See? That meant a lot to him. Felt good, didn't it?

links.title: Empathy: "That meant a lot to him. Felt good,..."
links.text: That meant a lot to him. Felt good, didn't it?

links.title: You: ""Fuck you, Garte.""
links.text: "Fuck you, Garte."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "He smiles ashamedly through the reb..."
links.text: He smiles ashamedly through the rebuke. He feels the sting for a moment before returning the key under the desk. "I understand. Is there anything else you want?"

links.title: You: ""You're a traitor to the Revolution..."
links.text: "You're a traitor to the Revolution, and should be first against the wall."

links.title: You: ""Do you feel bad enough to give me..."
links.text: "Do you feel bad enough to give me back my 20 reál?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "He shakes his head as he returns th..."
links.text: He shakes his head as he returns the key under the desk. "No. I don't feel bad enough to give you a refund. Now, is there anything else you want?"

links.title: Half Light: "FUCK SORRY. FUCK HIM. HE TREATED YO..."
links.text: FUCK SORRY. FUCK HIM. HE TREATED YOU LIKE GODDAMN HUMAN WASTE.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Thanks. I hope you found what you..."
links.text: "Thanks. I hope you found what you were looking for."

links.title: You: ""I found the victim's clothes.""
links.text: "I found the victim's clothes."

links.title: You: ""I found the victim's jeans.""
links.text: "I found the victim's jeans."

links.title: You: ""Just trash.""
links.text: "Just trash."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""As it should be. Anyway. Thank you..."
links.text: "As it should be. Anyway. Thank you for returning my key."

links.title: You: ""I found the victim's clothes in th..."
links.text: "I found the victim's clothes in the trash container out back."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""How... strange. *I* certainly didn..."
links.text: "How... strange. *I* certainly didn't put them there."

links.title: You: ""Maybe you don't remember putting t..."
links.text: "Maybe you don't remember putting them there. Maybe you were sleepwalking or... in a fugue state..."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "He grimaces. "I think *fugue states..."
links.text: He grimaces. "I think *fugue states* are more your *forte*, officer."

links.title: You: ""Could someone on your staff have p..."
links.text: "Could someone on your staff have put them there?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Sylvie had the keys before I got h..."
links.text: "Sylvie had the keys before I got here, and I can vouch for her. I can vouch for all my staff. None of us would tamper with a crime scene."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Sylvie had the keys before I got h..."
links.text: "Sylvie had the keys before I got here, and, as I've said before -- I can vouch for all my staff. None of us would tamper with a crime scene."

links.title: You: ""Who else has keys to the trash con..."
links.text: "Who else has keys to the trash container?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""The Trash Collection Service? CS M..."
links.text: "The Trash Collection Service? CS Municipal. I don't see why they would *put* anything in the trash, though."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Ah, the illusive CS Municipal. I d..."
links.text: "Ah, the illusive CS Municipal. I doubt we'll be able to track down who was sent here last and when. This will have to be one of those *little* threads that solves itself -- down the road."

links.title: Shivers: "On Clinton Street, near the Boogie..."
links.text: On Clinton Street, near the Boogie Street Diamond, a small truck rattles down an alleyway. It stops by a rusted trash container. Two men, their faces rough and swollen, jump out. They look at the container, despondently. CSM is written on their backs...

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "He turns to the man. "Thank you any..."
links.text: He turns to the man. "Thank you anyway."

links.title: You: ""Do you know these guys *personally..."
links.text: "Do you know these guys *personally*?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Nope. There's nothing more mysteri..."
links.text: "Nope. There's nothing more mysterious than the Martinaise Trash Collection Service -- never know who's coming, or when..."

links.title: You: ""Thanks. Let's talk about something..."
links.text: "Thanks. Let's talk about something else."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Yes?""
links.text: "Yes?"

links.title: You: ""So, about that money I owe...""
links.text: "So, about that money I owe..."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Yes, have you got it?""
links.text: "Yes, have you got it?"

links.title: You: ""I have your money.""
links.text: "I have your money."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "He glares at you suspiciously. "Wel..."
links.text: He glares at you suspiciously. "Well?"

links.title: You: ""Here's 130 reál.""
links.text: "Here's 130 reál."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Great, thank you officer, that's *..."
links.text: "Great, thank you officer, that's *all* I wanted -- payment for services rendered. If you continue to stay here, I just ask that you please pay your nightly bill in advance, starting tomorrow."

links.title: Suggestion: "He's not sorry about his behaviour..."
links.text: He's not sorry about his behaviour for your sake. Now that you have money, he really wants to make sure you're not angry with him.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""I'll unlock the electronic lock to..."
links.text: "I'll unlock the electronic lock to your room." He taps his foot against a metal box installed in the back of the bar counter. "All the doors lock automatically at 21.00."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Please pay for each night in advan..."
links.text: "Please pay for each night in advance starting tomorrow. Twenty reál per night."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I'll take a room here too." He ope..."
links.text: "I'll take a room here too." He opens his wallet.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Of course." He takes the money and..."
links.text: "Of course." He takes the money and hands him a keyring. "Always happy to have officers from the RCM as guests. Anything else I can do for you?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Anything else I can do for you?""
links.text: "Anything else I can do for you?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "He takes out his key chain and fidd..."
links.text: He takes out his key chain and fiddles with the mechanism behind the counter. "The electronic lock to your room has been disabled till 21.00 tomorrow."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Great, thank you officer, that's *..."
links.text: "Great, thank you officer, that's *all* I wanted, payment for services rendered."

links.title: Suggestion: "He's not sorry about his behaviour..."
links.text: He's not sorry about his behaviour for your sake. Now that you have money, he really wants to make sure you're not angry with him.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""It's good you paid before 21.00, o..."
links.text: "It's good you paid before 21.00, or your door would have been locked electronically." He taps his foot against a metal box installed in the back of the bar counter.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "He takes out his key chain and fidd..."
links.text: He takes out his key chain and fiddles with the mechanism behind the counter. "The electronic lock to your room will remain disabled till 21.00 tomorrow."

links.title: You: "(Slam the bills down on the counter..."
links.text: (Slam the bills down on the counter.) "I hope you choke on it."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Great, perfect, I hope you enjoy y..."
links.text: "Great, perfect, I hope you enjoy your freezing cold room with the window you broke *yourself*."

links.title: Suggestion: "You've really worn down his patienc..."
links.text: You've really worn down his patience. Even paying him didn't help!

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""I'll unlock the electronic lock to..."
links.text: "I'll unlock the electronic lock to your room." He taps his foot against a metal box at the bar counter. "All the doors lock automatically at 21.00."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Starting tomorrow, *please* pay fo..."
links.text: "Starting tomorrow, *please* pay for each night in advance. Twenty reál per night. If you don't have the money it's over for you, got it? You've got nowhere else to stay."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""He's right," the lieutenant whispe..."
links.text: "He's right," the lieutenant whispers, "you *really* have to sort out your money problems, starting tomorrow. I can't help you again."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I'll take a room here too." He ope..."
links.text: "I'll take a room here too." He opens his wallet.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Always happy to have officers from..."
links.text: "Always happy to have officers from the RCM as guests." He takes the money and hands him a keyring. "Anything else I can do for you?" He looks at the lieutenant, avoiding your gaze.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "He's right. You can't depend on Kim..."
links.text: He's right. You can't depend on Kim helping you out again.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Anything *else* I can do for you,..."
links.text: "Anything *else* I can do for you, officer?"

links.title: Tutorial Agent: "Time stops advancing after 02.00 in..."
links.text: Time stops advancing after 02.00 in the morning. If you haven't paid for your room by then, it's game over. Don't leave finding money to the last minute, however -- it's harder to make cash after nightfall, when the shops are closed and the streets empty.

links.text: He takes out his key chain and fiddles with the mechanism behind the counter. "The electronic lock to your room has been disabled till 21.00 tomorrow."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Great, perfect, I hope you enjoy y..."
links.text: "Great, perfect, I hope you enjoy your freezing cold room with the window you broke *yourself*."

links.title: Suggestion: "You've really worn down his patienc..."
links.text: You've really worn down his patience. Even paying him didn't help!

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""By the way, if you hadn't paid bef..."
links.text: "By the way, if you hadn't paid before 21.00, your door would have been locked electronically." He taps his foot against a metal box installed in the back of the bar counter.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "He takes out his key chain and fidd..."
links.text: He takes out his key chain and fiddles with the mechanism behind the counter. "The electronic lock to your room will remain disabled till 21.00 tomorrow."

links.text: "Here it is. Sorry for the trouble."

links.text: "I have your money."

links.text: He glares at you suspiciously. "Well?"

links.text: "Here it is. Sorry for the trouble."

links.text: "I have your money."

links.title: You: ""Here's 70 reál.""
links.text: "Here's 70 reál."

links.title: You: "(Slam the bills down on the counter..."
links.text: (Slam the bills down on the counter.)

links.title: You: ""Here it is. Sorry for the trouble.""
links.text: "Here it is. Sorry for the trouble."
