links.text: "I have your money."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "He glares at you suspiciously. "Wel..."
links.text: He glares at you suspiciously. "Well?"

links.title: You: ""Here's 100 reál.""
links.text: "Here's 100 reál."

links.title: You: "(Slam the bills down on the counter..."
links.text: (Slam the bills down on the counter.) "I hope you choke on it."

links.title: You: ""Here it is. Sorry for the trouble.""
links.text: "Here it is. Sorry for the trouble."

links.title: You: ""Can I pay with this cheque?" (Show..."
links.text: "Can I pay with this cheque?" (Show him the giant novelty cheque.)

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""You must be joking, right? You com..."
links.text: "You must be joking, right? You come here, trash everything -- and now you try to pay with a novelty cheque?" The cafeteria manager stares at you, baffled.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""This isn't a game show. I'm not go..."
links.text: "This isn't a game show. I'm not going to accept it. You owe me cold hard money... I want to see that money in the palm of my hand. Every single cent."

links.title: Half Light: "Damn you fat Evrart, your novelty c..."
links.text: Damn you fat Evrart, your novelty check is useless!

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You can cash it in at the local Fr..."
links.text: "You can cash it in at the local Frittte, near the harbour gates -- though it might not be enough to cover it..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""... and, come to think of it, Frit..."
links.text: "... and, come to think of it, Frittte's probably closed at this hour. They're open from seven to eleven."

links.title: You: ""How much do I owe you again?""
links.text: "How much do I owe you again?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""For the drinks -- 30 reál.""
links.text: "For the drinks -- 30 reál."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""For the room -- 60 reál.""
links.text: "For the room -- 60 reál."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""A lot. For the drinks and broken w..."
links.text: "A lot. For the drinks and broken window -- 70 reál."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""A lot. For the room and broken win..."
links.text: "A lot. For the room and broken window -- 100 reál."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""A lot. A lot-lot. For the room, dr..."
links.text: "A lot. A lot-lot. For the room, drinks, and broken window -- 130 reál."

links.title: You: ""I was wondering if we could come t..."
links.text: "I was wondering if we could come to some sort of arrangement for tonight."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Does that arrangement include... y..."
links.text: "Does that arrangement include... you paying me *what we already agreed* you owe me?"

links.title: You: ""I will pay you back tomorrow. I'm..."
links.text: "I will pay you back tomorrow. I'm an honest cop."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""As a police officer, you must unde..."
links.text: "As a police officer, you must understand that I cannot take you at your word -- without *evidence*."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "He pauses, realizing the contradict..."
links.text: He pauses, realizing the contradiction in his statement. "Evidence being money. You can't stay here without *money*."

links.title: You: ""It's cold out. I'll freeze to deat..."
links.text: "It's cold out. I'll freeze to death because I'm losing the stupid money-game."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Game? *Everything* is just a game..."
links.text: "Game? *Everything* is just a game to you, isn't it?"

links.title: You: ""Hold on, I still have my key, you..."
links.text: "Hold on, I still have my key, you know."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Good luck trying to use it." He ta..."
links.text: "Good luck trying to use it." He taps his foot against a metal box installed in the back of the counter.

links.title: Interfacing: "Draconian measures..."
links.text: Draconian measures...

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""All the locks have an electronic c..."
links.text: "All the locks have an electronic component. They have to be unlocked down here -- with a *master* key before your *guest* key will open the lock."

links.title: You: ""You know I still have my key. Your..."
links.text: "You know I still have my key. Your cheap-ass lock seems to be stuck, but I'll get it open."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Yeah, good luck with that." He tap..."
links.text: "Yeah, good luck with that." He taps his foot against a metal box installed in the back of the counter.

links.title: You: ""This conversation isn't going anyw..."
links.text: "This conversation isn't going anywhere, is it?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Not until you bring me the money.""
links.text: "Not until you bring me the money."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Okay..." He turns to you with a he..."
links.text: "Okay..." He turns to you with a heavy sigh. "I *might* have something in my motor carriage we can use. When you're done here."

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "I *really* didn't want to resort to..."
links.text: I *really* didn't want to resort to this, the man is thinking.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Oh, lieutenant -- we're *done* her..."
links.text: "Oh, lieutenant -- we're *done* here."

links.title: You: ""I'll find a way in. I'll *break* t..."
links.text: "I'll find a way in. I'll *break* the door down."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Wonderful. *Try* to do that. I'll..."
links.text: "Wonderful. *Try* to do that. I'll have to call you an ambulance."

links.title: You: ""C'mon man. After everything I've b..."
links.text: "C'mon man. After everything I've been through..."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""What about what *I* have been thro..."
links.text: "What about what *I* have been through, huh? You're not the goddamn *protagonist* of this story -- I am. This is *my* hostel-cafeteria and I need my money."

links.title: Conceptualization: "Literary demotion! That's the worst..."
links.text: Literary demotion! That's the worst...

links.title: You: "Kim is about to say something. Let..."
links.text: Kim is about to say something. Let him.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I understand your predicament as t..."
links.text: "I understand your predicament as the manager. However..." He adjusts his glasses.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""...I feel I must remind you that w..."
links.text: "...I feel I must remind you that we are here to conduct an important investigation that also affects *your* business."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Forgive me for saying this, but yo..."
links.text: "Forgive me for saying this, but your colleague seems more committed to drinking and..." He stops mid-sentence.

links.title: Authority: "He shrinks back a bit under the lie..."
links.text: He shrinks back a bit under the lieutenant's severe gaze.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""I mean no offence. It's really not..."
links.text: "I mean no offence. It's really nothing personal. I just *have* to protect the interests of this establishment."

links.title: You: ""I can pay it off with my net worth..."
links.text: "I can pay it off with my net worth if that's cool?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""No, of course it's not *cool*." He..."
links.text: "No, of course it's not *cool*." He shoots you a look of disbelief. "What am I supposed to do with your *net worth*? I need cash, moron."

links.title: You: ""But I paid for the work on that mo..."
links.text: "But I paid for the work on that monument out there. Does that mean nothing to you?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""That was *you*? Of course it was...."
links.text: "That was *you*? Of course it was. The man behind every new misery in my life." He looks you right in the eyes. "But let's get back to the topic of the money you owe me."

links.title: You: ""Actually, let's talk about somethi..."
links.text: "Actually, let's talk about something else."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Like what? I was really enjoying t..."
links.text: "Like what? I was really enjoying talking about the *money* you owe me..."

links.title: You: ""I need a drink. Can you pour me on..."
links.text: "I need a drink. Can you pour me one?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Do I have a shaker in my hand? Is..."
links.text: "Do I have a shaker in my hand? Is this..." He points to his empty hand. "Is this a shaker?"

links.title: Empathy: "He sounds irritated."
links.text: He sounds irritated.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "... and it's not a shaker. It's not..."
links.text: ... and it's not a shaker. It's nothing. He's holding nothing.

links.title: You: ""You sound irritated -- why? All I..."
links.text: "You sound irritated -- why? All I want is a drink."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Am I wearing a little bow tie? Am..."
links.text: "Am I wearing a little bow tie? Am I wearing a bow tie and doing this?" He shakes the imaginary shaker, furiously.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Am I smiling? Do you see me smilin..."
links.text: "Am I smiling? Do you see me smiling and shaking my little shaker? No? Do you know *why?*"

links.title: Logic: "Because he's not a bartender."
links.text: Because he's not a bartender.

links.title: You: ""Because you're not a bartender?""
links.text: "Because you're not a bartender?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""That's right -- I'm THE CAFETERIA..."
links.text: "That's right -- I'm THE CAFETERIA MANAGER." He calms his breath. "I'm glad we cleared that. Was there anything else?"

links.title: Half Light: "What you want is a GOD DAMN DRINK...."
links.text: What you want is a GOD DAMN DRINK. How is that so hard to understand?

links.title: Rhetoric: "Play it calm. This man needs to und..."
links.text: Play it calm. This man needs to understand you need a drink to help the community deal with police-stuff.

links.title: You: ""I want a fucking drink, asshole!""
links.text: "I want a fucking drink, asshole!"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Well, you're not getting it!" He s..."
links.text: "Well, you're not getting it!" He slams his hand on the counter, "*Asshole*!"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""This is a thoughtful exchange, but..."
links.text: "This is a thoughtful exchange, but can we move on please?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Now -- was there anything else you..."
links.text: "Now -- was there anything else you needed?"

links.title: You: ""You don't understand the seriousne..."
links.text: "You don't understand the seriousness of the situation. I'm an alcoholic. I need my fix."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Even more reason for me not to ser..."
links.text: "Even more reason for me not to serve you, sir. Was there anything else you needed -- other than alcohol?"

links.title: You: ""Please make an exception. I got th..."
links.text: "Please make an exception. I got the shakes bad, man. I need my pacifier."

links.title: You: ""I am an alcohol-operated detective..."
links.text: "I am an alcohol-operated detective. If you want me to solve crimes or do whatever it is I'm here to do you need to insert alcohol into my mouth."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Oh, well, in that case, let me pou..."
links.text: "Oh, well, in that case, let me pour you a nice big refreshing Marinella. Do you want that out of a glass or a pineapple?"

links.title: You: ""Glass.""
links.text: "Glass."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Don't be an imbecile, I'm not goin..."
links.text: "Don't be an imbecile, I'm not going to serve you a Marinella. I have work to do -- and broken things to fix -- if that was all, I'd like to return to it."

links.title: You: ""Pineapple.""
links.text: "Pineapple."

links.title: You: ""You do *not* want to taunt me -- n..."
links.text: "You do *not* want to taunt me -- not when it comes to Marinellas!"

links.title: You: ""Fine, then. I had something else I..."
links.text: "Fine, then. I had something else I needed."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Like what?""
links.text: "Like what?"

links.title: You: ""Why?""
links.text: "Why?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Because I'm not a bartender. I'm a..."
links.text: "Because I'm not a bartender. I'm a cafeteria manager. Is there anything else you wanted?"

links.title: You: ""I feel like you've given me a hint..."
links.text: "I feel like you've given me a hint previously, but it isn't connecting..."

links.title: You: ""No. There's nothing there.""
links.text: "No. There's nothing there."

links.title: You: "Say nothing."
links.text: Say nothing.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "It's not a shaker. It's nothing. He..."
links.text: It's not a shaker. It's nothing. He's holding nothing. It is but an imitation.

links.title: You: ""Garte, I saw another *thing* at th..."
links.text: "Garte, I saw another *thing* at the Whirling..."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Another thing -- great. I love tho..."
links.text: "Another thing -- great. I love those."

links.title: You: ""I saw a sign that said the mess ha..."
links.text: "I saw a sign that said the mess hall is reserved for the Union."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Yes -- not the whole damn Union, t..."
links.text: "Yes -- not the whole damn Union, thank god. Just the nastiest and *loudest* faction." He tosses his head in disdain.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""They come here in the evenings. Du..."
links.text: "They come here in the evenings. Dumb, unruly types. Think they're Big Shit. But they're good customers -- they place big orders, and always pay *on time*."

links.title: Authority: "He hates the Union, but grudgingly..."
links.text: He hates the Union, but grudgingly recognizes its power over him -- so he's directing his frustration at you instead. Retaliate!

links.title: You: ""It's a shame you've gotta suck up..."
links.text: "It's a shame you've gotta suck up to the Union to stay afloat."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""I don't. I'm simply providing a se..."
links.text: "I don't. I'm simply providing a service -- or, really, facilitating the offering of services to *paying* customers, and..." He runs out of steam. "It doesn't matter. I don't have to explain myself to you."

links.title: You: "Let it go. You're above gratuitous..."
links.text: Let it go. You're above gratuitous baiting.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We should find out who this loud f..."
links.text: "We should find out who this loud faction is, occupying the booth. Loudness means talkative -- and we need info." The lieutenant gives you a meaningful nod.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Was there something else? Because..."
links.text: "Was there something else? Because I have coasters to stack. And glasses to clean. *Apparently* that's what I do now."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We should find out who this loud f..."
links.text: "We should find out who this loud faction is, occupying the booth. Loudness means talkative -- and we need info." He gives you a meaningful nod.

links.title: You: ""How do we find them?""
links.text: "How do we find them?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We don't. We have to wait. They'll..."
links.text: "We don't. We have to wait. They'll show up sooner or later." He looks toward the booth. "Men get hungry. Even men on strike."

links.title: Reaction Speed: "You glance at the clock on the wall..."
links.text: You glance at the clock on the wall behind the manager. Hah!

links.title: You: ""It's after 16.00. The sign said *r..."
links.text: "It's after 16.00. The sign said *reserved starting 16.00*. Why isn't anyone in the mess hall?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Good question." He turns to the ca..."
links.text: "Good question." He turns to the cafeteria manager.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""They're probably getting drunk. Or..."
links.text: "They're probably getting drunk. Or *protesting* something somewhere. Or laying low after the, you know, lynching."

links.title: Suggestion: "Whatever he may feel about you, he..."
links.text: Whatever he may feel about you, he can't miss the opportunity to throw you a look of what he assumes is shared understanding. Go with it.

links.title: You: "(Nod sagely.) "Yes, I think I see....."
links.text: (Nod sagely.) "Yes, I think I see..."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""The Union guys think they're untou..."
links.text: "The Union guys think they're untouchable. They probably fucking killed that guy or something... and now think they can hide out till it all blows over and it's fair weather again in Martinaise."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Hmh." The lieutenant thinks. "I ha..."
links.text: "Hmh." The lieutenant thinks. "I have a feeling we'll make their acquaintance sooner or later."

links.title: You: ""Why's that?""
links.text: "Why's that?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""They probably fucking killed that..."
links.text: "They probably fucking killed that guy or something, that's why."

links.title: You: "Hold your peace -- best not to nitp..."
links.text: Hold your peace -- best not to nitpick.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We don't. We have to wait. They'll..."
links.text: "We don't. We have to wait. They'll show up sooner or later." He looks toward the booth. "Men get hungry. Even striking men. If not today, then they'll be here tomorrow."

links.title: Logic: "There are these things called *days..."
links.text: There are these things called *days*. You sleep between them. He's saying they'll come *after* you've slept. (Just making clear you got that.)

links.title: You: ""Garte, I saw a sign that said I co..."
links.text: "Garte, I saw a sign that said I couldn't go into the kitchen. Why can't I go into the kitchen?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""What are you, a cook now? That's n..."
links.text: "What are you, a cook now? That's none of your business."

links.title: You: ""Maybe I *am* a cook?""
links.text: "Maybe I *am* a cook?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""You're not. You're a menace..." He..."
links.text: "You're not. You're a menace..." He gets a hold of himself. "Fine, okay, the kitchen is closed until 13:00 because the *real* cook is working. You can snoop around after that -- if you must."

links.title: You: ""I have a search warrant.""
links.text: "I have a search warrant."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""No, you don't.""
links.text: "No, you don't."

links.title: You: ""You better believe it, fucker.""
links.text: "You better believe it, fucker."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Fucker?" He shakes his head. "Lay..."
links.text: "Fucker?" He shakes his head. "Lay off the swear words, they don't make you *cool*. This isn't kindergarten."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Besides, the RCM doesn't *do* sear..."
links.text: "Besides, the RCM doesn't *do* search warrants. I know the law. You'll just have to wait for the kitchen to open -- if you *have* to get in there. Which you don't."

links.title: Savoir Faire: "You do realize you can just go into..."
links.text: You do realize you can just go into the kitchen at 13:00? No need for superstar charm or Sam Bo style antics here.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Sam Bo is an acronym for Samaran bo..."
links.text: Sam Bo is an acronym for Samaran boxing. Graceful martial arts stuff. *Sam Bo style* implies stealth, cleverness, and cool. Just letting you know.

links.title: You: ""How did you know?""
links.text: "How did you know?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""If you had a warrant, you'd be sho..."
links.text: "If you had a warrant, you'd be shoving it in my face right now." He crosses his arms.

links.title: You: ""But there may be something pertine..."
links.text: "But there may be something pertinent to the investigation in the kitchen."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "He rolls his eyes. "He wasn't pan-f..."
links.text: He rolls his eyes. "He wasn't pan-fried. He was *lynched*. What could the kitchen *possibly* have to do with..." He changes his mind.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Fine. Okay. The kitchen is closed..."
links.text: "Fine. Okay. The kitchen is closed until 13:00 because the cook is working. You can snoop around after that -- if you must."

links.title: You: ""But I'm really hungry.""
links.text: "But I'm really hungry."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""And want me to make an exception f..."
links.text: "And want me to make an exception for you? You're not even a hostel guest till you pay your outstanding bills..." He changes his mind.

links.title: You: ""So the phone line is dead?""
links.text: "So the phone line is dead?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Yes, and the phone company is taki..."
links.text: "Yes, and the phone company is taking its sweet time sending someone to fix it." He shakes his head and adds: "Losers."

links.title: You: ""That's pretty strange.""
links.text: "That's pretty strange."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""It's not *strange*, it's inconveni..."
links.text: "It's not *strange*, it's inconvenient."

links.title: You: ""No, no, no. Something nefarious is..."
links.text: "No, no, no. Something nefarious is definitely afoot."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "He rolls his eyes. "If you say so.""
links.text: He rolls his eyes. "If you say so."

links.title: You: ""Is it true that there was foul pla..."
links.text: "Is it true that there was foul play?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "He wrinkles his nose. "Who told you..."
links.text: He wrinkles his nose. "Who told you that?"

links.title: You: ""Lena.""
links.text: "Lena."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Fine, yeah, it looked like someone..."
links.text: "Fine, yeah, it looked like someone had messed with the wiring. It was shortly after the hanging, but I don't know if it's at all related... Plenty of assholes around here who aren't murderers."

links.title: Suggestion: "He's exhausted from years of dealin..."
links.text: He's exhausted from years of dealing with the *assholes*. That's why he's trying so hard not to be one too...

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""If you do find out who cut the lin..."
links.text: "If you do find out who cut the line, though, let me know so I can forward them the repair bill."

links.title: You: ""I would never disclose my sources...."
links.text: "I would never disclose my sources. That would be dishonourable."

links.title: You: ""It doesn't matter. I just want to..."
links.text: "It doesn't matter. I just want to know who you suspect."

links.title: You: ""Klaasje. In Room #3. She nicked th..."
links.text: "Klaasje. In Room #3. She nicked the phone line."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Why?" He stops himself. "No. Fuck..."
links.text: "Why?" He stops himself. "No. Fuck it. I don't wanna know. I don't want to know why these degenerates do what they do. I thought we had *one* good guest in the building..."

links.title: Suggestion: "He really doesn't like it being Kla..."
links.text: He really doesn't like it being Klaasje.

links.title: You: ""Yeah, I bet you didn't want it to..."
links.text: "Yeah, I bet you didn't want it to be her."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""What's that supposed to mean? Fuck..."
links.text: "What's that supposed to mean? Fuck you, buddy -- she's not my taste. Good thing she pays for her stuff on time, I'll forward her the bill and be done with it."

links.title: Volition: "Hmm... wow. She really isn't his ta..."
links.text: Hmm... wow. She really isn't his taste. Her spell hasn't spread here.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Now was there anything else? I hav..."
links.text: "Now was there anything else? I have, like, four thousand coasters to stack and then I need to wash dishes because it turns out I have to do that too now."

links.title: You: ""Well, anyway, mystery solved. I do..."
links.text: "Well, anyway, mystery solved. I don't like loose ends."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Yeah, neither do I. Thank you for..."
links.text: "Yeah, neither do I. Thank you for telling me I guess. Good thing she pays for her stuff on time -- I'll forward her the bill and be done with it."

links.title: Reaction Speed: "Hmm... sounds like she has money tu..."
links.text: Hmm... sounds like she has money tucked away somewhere. Enough to be a stable paying guest.

links.title: You: ""You have Lena. Lena is a good cust..."
links.text: "You have Lena. Lena is a good customer."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Yeah, well -- she's not a guest, i..."
links.text: "Yeah, well -- she's not a guest, is she?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Anyway, I'll forward that woman he..."
links.text: "Anyway, I'll forward that woman her bill and be done with it... Now, was there anything else?"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""What?" the woman chimes in. "Did s..."
links.text: "What?" the woman chimes in. "Did someone mention my name?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""We were just paying you a complime..."
links.text: "We were just paying you a compliment. And finding out a *degenerate* from room 3 nicked the phone line. Everything is okay here!" he yells, then turns to you.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Good thing that guest pays for her..."
links.text: "Good thing that guest pays for her stuff on time -- I'll forward her the bill and be done with it. Was there anything else?"

links.title: You: ""There's a mysterious *blue steel d..."
links.text: "There's a mysterious *blue steel door* in the back of the kitchen."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Oh, yes, that door, sure. There's..."
links.text: "Oh, yes, that door, sure. There's nothing *mysterious* about it. It's just a door." He shrugs.

links.title: You: ""Do you know what's behind it? Do y..."
links.text: "Do you know what's behind it? Do you have..."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""No, I don't have a key -- I don't..."
links.text: "No, I don't have a key -- I don't know how to get there. And I don't *care* either. It's not like I've been *wondering* about it for ten years. It's just the Frittte warehouse probably."

links.title: Drama: "Wondering about it is, of course, e..."
links.text: Wondering about it is, of course, exactly what he's been doing. For ten years.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Or some boring storage space with..."
links.text: "Or some boring storage space with a bunch of old junk... and dust. Junk and dust." He runs his finger across the counter to check for dirt.

links.title: Composure: "He's attempting to maintain an air..."
links.text: He's attempting to maintain an air of indifference. It's absolutely not convincing.

links.title: You: ""I think you'd like to know what's..."
links.text: "I think you'd like to know what's back there."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Fine, okay. A little." He shrugs...."
links.text: "Fine, okay. A little." He shrugs. "But my job doesn't leave me time for wondering about *one* locked door in *one* of the cafeterias I manage..."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""So I haven't opened it. I *have* c..."
links.text: "So I haven't opened it. I *have* cleaned the whole place a hundred times over, though -- after the *animals*. And I haven't found a key. So good luck with that."

links.title: You: "Let him get to pretend he's indiffe..."
links.text: Let him get to pretend he's indifferent.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "He looks at the dust on his finger..."
links.text: He looks at the dust on his finger and wipes it off.

links.title: You: ""So, just to be clear -- you don't..."
links.text: "So, just to be clear -- you don't know how to open it?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Nope. No idea -- don't *want* to e..."
links.text: "Nope. No idea -- don't *want* to either."

links.title: You: ""Okay then, never mind.""
links.text: "Okay then, never mind."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Yes. What else?""
links.text: "Yes. What else?"

links.title: You: ""Garte, what if I told I got into t..."
links.text: "Garte, what if I told I got into the back room? Behind the blue door in the kitchen."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Oh? Okay. Well." He controls his e..."
links.text: "Oh? Okay. Well." He controls his excitement well. "I did hear you make noise back there. So -- good for you."

links.title: Composure: "He's really, really holding himself..."
links.text: He's really, really holding himself back here.

links.title: Volition: "It takes a lot of willpower not to..."
links.text: It takes a lot of willpower not to ask. Obviously he's been wanting to know what's behind the door...

links.title: You: ""Aren't you gonna ask me what's bac..."
links.text: "Aren't you gonna ask me what's back there?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Okay -- what *is* back there?""
links.text: "Okay -- what *is* back there?"

links.title: You: ""Skeletons. A mausoleum of the dead.""
links.text: "Skeletons. A mausoleum of the dead."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Yes. Ha ha. What's *actually* behi..."
links.text: "Yes. Ha ha. What's *actually* behind there?"

links.title: You: ""Pinball machines. A pinball worksh..."
links.text: "Pinball machines. A pinball workshop."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Hah! I knew it. I've always wonder..."
links.text: "Hah! I knew it. I've always wondered where those machines by the door came from -- *and* they told me there was some kind of pinball thing here too..."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""I knew it." He repeats. "Were ther..."
links.text: "I knew it." He repeats. "Were there any back there? In working order I mean?"

links.title: You: ""Why? Do you want to play? Because..."
links.text: "Why? Do you want to play? Because I might be up for a game..."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""No, I was... just wondering." He a..."
links.text: "No, I was... just wondering." He appears to be making a calculation in his head. "If you found pinball machines there..."

links.title: Drama: "He was *wondering* about something..."
links.text: He was *wondering* about something business-related. About how much money he could make off one.

links.title: You: ""Thinking of turning this place bac..."
links.text: "Thinking of turning this place back into a pinball arcade?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "He scowls. "No. But we could... *di..."
links.text: He scowls. "No. But we could... *diversify* the entertainment options. Seeing as you've opened the door back there... The machine we have in the corner now is broken."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""It wouldn't hurt to get a little l..."
links.text: "It wouldn't hurt to get a little life in here. Other than the hellish karaoke machine. That one's always *causing trouble*."

links.title: Logic: "Yeah, those numbers he's adding up..."
links.text: Yeah, those numbers he's adding up must be making good sense to him right now.

links.title: Suggestion: "Sounds like he cares about the plac..."
links.text: Sounds like he cares about the place. He's not going to be overjoyed to hear that it's part of the Doomed Commercial Area.

links.title: Inland Empire: "He should still know. You have to b..."
links.text: He should still know. You have to be *forewarned* about these things.

links.title: You: ""If you're thinking of selling thos..."
links.text: "If you're thinking of selling those pinball machines, I want a fat cut. C-Suite shit." (Beat your chest.) "I'm a disruptor."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "He rolls his eyes. "Those machines..."
links.text: He rolls his eyes. "Those machines are Whirling property. But, if it makes you *feel* any better, I'm *not* planning to sell them."

links.title: You: ""I feel a capitalist plot coming up.""
links.text: "I feel a capitalist plot coming up."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Capitalist *plot*." He rolls his e..."
links.text: "Capitalist *plot*." He rolls his eyes. "The pinball we have in the corner now is broken -- I want to diversify the entertainment options."

links.title: You: ""Didn't check. Pinball isn't releva..."
links.text: "Didn't check. Pinball isn't relevant to the investigation."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""I was... just wondering." He appea..."
links.text: "I was... just wondering." He appears to be making a calculation in his head. "If you found pinball machines there..."

links.title: You: ""Didn't check. Pinball is stupid.""
links.text: "Didn't check. Pinball is stupid."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant nods in agreeance."
links.text: The lieutenant nods in agreeance.

links.title: You: ""Nothing. The black gaping maw at t..."
links.text: "Nothing. The black gaping maw at the end of Time."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "He shakes his head. "There is no ga..."
links.text: He shakes his head. "There is no gaping maw. If you don't want to tell me you don't have to. It's okay."

links.title: Drama: "*But please do still tell me!*"
links.text: *But please do still tell me!*

links.title: You: ""I have to warn you -- I may have d..."
links.text: "I have to warn you -- I may have discovered that the Whirling is part of the Doomed Commercial Area."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""What?" He looks mildly startled. "..."
links.text: "What?" He looks mildly startled. "Why would you say that? We're at a *completely* different address from that whole thing."

links.title: Reaction Speed: "So he knows of the Doomed Commercia..."
links.text: So he knows of the Doomed Commercial Area. *And* its address. He's thought about this.

links.title: You: ""Wait -- so you *know* of the curse!""
links.text: "Wait -- so you *know* of the curse!"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Everyone *knows* of it.""
links.text: "Everyone *knows* of it."

links.title: You: ""The Whirling is adjacent to them...."
links.text: "The Whirling is adjacent to them. And there's also the pinball workshop. The Whirling hasn't always been a hostel..."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Obviously it hasn't." He makes a s..."
links.text: "Obviously it hasn't." He makes a sweeping gesture with his arm. "Look at the pre-revolutionary tile work. This is an old, proud building. So what if there was a little pinball hall here before?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""For 14 years, man -- that's how lo..."
links.text: "For 14 years, man -- that's how long I've worked here. I've kept this place up through hail and through sleet. Fuck me, if some Doom Ghost..." he steadies his voice.

links.title: Empathy: "He's done a fine job too. Though he..."
links.text: He's done a fine job too. Though he's spoken of the place dismissively before, the hostel is actually very important to him.

links.title: You: ""You really care about the Whirling..."
links.text: "You really care about the Whirling, huh."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Yeah." He sighs. "It's *slowly* gr..."
links.text: "Yeah." He sighs. "It's *slowly* growing on me again. It's beautiful, in its own way -- especially for this neighbourhood. I've been trying to keep it that way..."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Even if it is part of the damn Doo..."
links.text: "Even if it is part of the damn Doomed Commercial Area..."

links.title: You: ""Aha! So you finally admit it?""
links.text: "Aha! So you finally admit it?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Yes, your police skills have deliv..."
links.text: "Yes, your police skills have delivered. I'm sure you'll get a commendation. Maybe even a promotion."

links.title: You: ""You shouldn't be so worried about..."
links.text: "You shouldn't be so worried about that label, you know."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""*I* don't place much stock in the..."
links.text: "*I* don't place much stock in the curse and so on, but the label frightens the clientèle. Who wants to stay at a *doomed* hostel? Everything's doomed enough without that..."

links.title: You: ""You must really care about this pl..."
links.text: "You must really care about this place, since you've worked here for so long."

links.title: You: ""Who *owns* this place?""
links.text: "Who *owns* this place?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Some real estate management compan..."
links.text: "Some real estate management company. They never come around here, just collect money from afar. Honestly, I think *some* money laundering might be involved."

links.title: Authority: "There is an acrimonious note. It's..."
links.text: There is an acrimonious note. It's clear he's doing the real work around here.

links.title: You: ""And who named it Whirling-in-Rags?""
links.text: "And who named it Whirling-in-Rags?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Well, it sure as hell wasn't the r..."
links.text: "Well, it sure as hell wasn't the real estate company."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It was you?""
links.text: "It was you?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""You look surprised? What? It's a g..."
links.text: "You look surprised? What? It's a great name, I know. Cafeteria managers come up with great names too. It's from a song."

links.title: You: ""A song?""
links.text: "A song?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""*Hail Holy Queen* by The Etenniers..."
links.text: "*Hail Holy Queen* by The Etenniers. 'Hail holy queen of the sea,'" he quotes. "'You're whirling in rags -- you're vast and you're sad."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Good pick," the lieutenant nods."
links.text: "Good pick," the lieutenant nods.

links.title: Conceptualization: "Good pick."
links.text: Good pick.

links.title: You: ""You did?""
links.text: "You did?"

links.title: You: ""What about those other cafeterias..."
links.text: "What about those other cafeterias you manage?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""What about them?" He shrugs. "One..."
links.text: "What about them?" He shrugs. "One is a basement dive frequented by chain-smoking communists. I can't *tell* you how sick I am of Kras Mazov and Ignus Nilsen and all those old ghosts..."

links.title: Reaction Speed: "He's hesitating, not sure if he sho..."
links.text: He's hesitating, not sure if he should share this information with you. Encourage him.

links.title: You: ""And the others?""
links.text: "And the others?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""The *other* is a kebab cart. It's..."
links.text: "The *other* is a kebab cart. It's very *successful* in its way, but... it's nothing like the Whirling."

links.title: You: "He doesn't have to tell you anythin..."
links.text: He doesn't have to tell you anything he doesn't want to.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Anyway, I thought we were talking..."
links.text: "Anyway, I thought we were talking about the Whirling."

links.title: Logic: "You're guessing there aren't *that*..."
links.text: You're guessing there aren't *that* many others.

links.title: You: ""Well -- good luck to you with this..."
links.text: "Well -- good luck to you with this place then." (Conclude.)

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Luck has got nothing to do with it..."
links.text: "Luck has got nothing to do with it." He looks to where the hidden room is. "I need to think about where I'm gonna place those pinballs -- I have a feeling they're gonna help."

links.title: Rhetoric: "Against the Doom, it's implied."
links.text: Against the Doom, it's implied.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""So if you didn't have anything els..."
links.text: "So if you didn't have anything else to tell me -- about my establishment -- can we, you know, wrap it up?"

links.title: You: ""Well -- too bad it's all doomed th..."
links.text: "Well -- too bad it's all doomed then." (Conclude.)

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Whatever." He attempts a scowl, bu..."
links.text: "Whatever." He attempts a scowl, but he's too absorbed in his thoughts to finish it. "Was there anything else? Because I need to *think* -- about how I'm gonna get those pinballs in here..."

links.title: You: ""The Whirling is listed on the inte..."
links.text: "The Whirling is listed on the intercom outside. As one of the businesses in Building B -- of *The Doomed Commercial Area*."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""I've been working here for a *long..."
links.text: "I've been working here for a *long* time, and that intercom has *never* been used by the Whirling."

links.title: You: ""Hold on -- not once? Isn't that *a..."
links.text: "Hold on -- not once? Isn't that *already* a sign of decline?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""It's a *sign* of the Whirling-in-R..."
links.text: "It's a *sign* of the Whirling-in-Rags not being part of the Doomed Commercial Area. If anything -- we're *revitalizing* this neighbourhood."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Relax, Mr. Garte. I'm sure there i..."
links.text: "Relax, Mr. Garte. I'm sure there is no *Doom*. He simply wants to share his discoveries with you."

links.title: You: ""The Whirling was once the East Del..."
links.text: "The Whirling was once the East Delta Pinball Arcade, before it failed. It's only a matter of time before the Whirling fails too!"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Does this *look* like part of a *D..."
links.text: "Does this *look* like part of a *Doomed* Commercial Area?" He makes a sweeping gesture. "This pre-revolutionary tile work? These high ceilings? The nice rooms? Well, *most* of the rooms..."

links.title: You: ""The Whirling was once the East Del..."
links.text: "The Whirling was once the East Delta Pinball Arcade, which failed. Though perhaps the Whirling will *escape* the curse..."

links.title: You: ""There's a peephole in the wall.""
links.text: "There's a peephole in the wall."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "He startles. "What wall?""
links.text: He startles. "What wall?"

links.title: You: ""Upstairs in the secret back room -..."
links.text: "Upstairs in the secret back room -- right next to Klaasje's bedroom. I think it's used for *looking in* on guests."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""I'll have it fixed at once. Thank..."
links.text: "I'll have it fixed at once. Thank you for letting me know. I assure you -- the Whirling does *not* abide spying on its guests."

links.title: Composure: "The colour has drained from his fac..."
links.text: The colour has drained from his face.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "What a shame. To fix such a good pe..."
links.text: What a shame. To fix such a good peephole.

links.title: You: ""Are you sure *you* haven't been sp..."
links.text: "Are you sure *you* haven't been spying on your guests?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Absolutely not." He breathes in an..."
links.text: "Absolutely not." He breathes in and out. "Fuck you for even implying it. It wasn't me, it wasn't my staff. The establishment will look at it and ascertain what it was."

links.title: Drama: "Well, he's definitely not lying --..."
links.text: Well, he's definitely not lying -- he wouldn't endanger this business like that.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Sir, he was only asking a question..."
links.text: "Sir, he was only asking a question. It's his job -- and mine. See that it's covered."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Yes. I absolutely will." He calms..."
links.text: "Yes. I absolutely will." He calms his breathing. "Sorry. It's been a bit of a day -- and now a hole in the wall."

links.title: You: ""Maybe someone on the staff was *cu..."
links.text: "Maybe someone on the staff was *curious*..."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""No, we don't hire staff like that...."
links.text: "No, we don't hire staff like that. Thank you for letting me know -- and it will be taken care of as soon as possible."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""I vouch for my staff as I would fo..."
links.text: "I vouch for my staff as I would for myself... and I certainly wasn't the one making holes in our walls." He folds his arms and glares at you defiantly.

links.title: You: ""Couldn't you *keep* the hole there..."
links.text: "Couldn't you *keep* the hole there? What if there are some hotties staying in that room..." (Wink.)

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Absolutely not. That would be idio..."
links.text: "Absolutely not. That would be idiotic. I have no idea why you're even saying this right now..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""In your defence -- neither do I.""
links.text: "In your defence -- neither do I."

links.title: You: ""Alright -- you've been notified."..."
links.text: "Alright -- you've been notified." (Conclude.)

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Thank you, I'll patch it up person..."
links.text: "Thank you, I'll patch it up personally. Was there something else about the establishment? I hope not..."

links.title: You: ""There's something else I want to a..."
links.text: "There's something else I want to ask about."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""What?""
links.text: "What?"

links.title: Reaction Speed: "By the way -- you should come back..."
links.text: By the way -- you should come back to this *thing*-based questionnaire if you see anything interesting in the Whirling later!

links.title: Inland Empire: "Hmm... you feel like you should com..."
links.text: Hmm... you feel like you should come back to this *thing*-based questionnaire if you see anything interesting in the Whirling later.

links.title: You: ""I've seen something here at the Wh..."
links.text: "I've seen something here at the Whirling, Garte. A thing I need to talk about."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "He rolls his eyes. "What *thing*?""
links.text: He rolls his eyes. "What *thing*?"

links.title: You: ""So I talked to Sylvie." (Wink.)"
links.text: "So I talked to Sylvie." (Wink.)

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""God..." He does not look too pleas..."
links.text: "God..." He does not look too pleased.

links.title: Empathy: "Oh -- but he *should* be. Lay it on..."
links.text: Oh -- but he *should* be. Lay it on him!

links.title: You: ""Turns out she's a whore who likes..."
links.text: "Turns out she's a whore who likes to ride the cock carousel."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Wonderful.""
links.text: "Wonderful."

links.title: Empathy: "It is! It's wonder-full!"
links.text: It is! It's wonder-full!

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""What?" He squints at you, worried...."
links.text: "What?" He squints at you, worried. "What does that mean -- *cock carousel*?"

links.title: You: ""She rides the cock carousel until..."
links.text: "She rides the cock carousel until she's too old to ride it. Then she settles down with a *provider*."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "He realizes something. "Does it mea..."
links.text: He realizes something. "Does it mean you talked to her? What else did she say about me?"

links.title: Empathy: "What *else* do you need?"
links.text: What *else* do you need?

links.title: You: ""That was roughly it.""
links.text: "That was roughly it."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "The man leans his hands on the corn..."
links.text: The man leans his hands on the corner and sighs. His head drops between the shoulders, heavy and defeated.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""She broke the bird, you know. The..."
links.text: "She broke the bird, you know. The great skua. I found it on the ground with a broken wing. On the morning she left."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""I should have known -- it was her..."
links.text: "I should have known -- it was her way of telling me to piss off. I should stuff it up my ass." He stops and stares at the counter.

links.title: Logic: "*Or* you broke the bird. That's why..."
links.text: *Or* you broke the bird. That's why you brought the replacement. Out of guilt...

links.title: Empathy: "YES! The bird is connected to this...."
links.text: YES! The bird is connected to this. It's a symbol of hope and she broke it.

links.title: You: ""Or... you know. *Maybe* I broke it?""
links.text: "Or... you know. *Maybe* I broke it?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""No. It was her." His voice is cold..."
links.text: "No. It was her." His voice is cold now. "She's off to ride that carousel you told me about. Heh..." A mirthless laugh. "Cock carousel -- I understand now."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "He takes a bottle of wine off the s..."
links.text: He takes a bottle of wine off the shelf and pours himself a glass. "They ride the cock carousel until the clock runs out. Here. Have the rest." He corks the bottle and hands it to you.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Now, let me have a drink and think..."
links.text: "Now, let me have a drink and think about this shit for a moment -- on my own." He stares into the blood red liquid in the cup.

links.title: Empathy: "And there we have it. Isn't that be..."
links.text: And there we have it. Isn't that beautiful? Another situation fixed by Doctor Love.

links.title: You: ""Yeah, man. Signals. Mixed signals...."
links.text: "Yeah, man. Signals. Mixed signals. This is classic cock carousel behaviour."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Heh..." A mirthless laugh. "Cock c..."
links.text: "Heh..." A mirthless laugh. "Cock carousel -- I think I understand now. It's what they ride. Until, like, 39."

links.title: You: ""Broken bird. Feathers." (Nod knowi..."
links.text: "Broken bird. Feathers." (Nod knowingly.) "This is all part of the mind-fuck on the cock-carousel."

links.title: Logic: "*Or* you broke the bird. It can als..."
links.text: *Or* you broke the bird. It can also be that. I think Sylvie even...

links.title: You: ""You don't want to know.""
links.text: "You don't want to know."

links.title: You: ""Yeah, she said that she likes the..."
links.text: "Yeah, she said that she likes the cock carousel very much. So fun!" (Depict a carousel of cocks going merrily around.)

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "He looks at you spinning your arms,..."
links.text: He looks at you spinning your arms, then leans on the corner and sighs. His head drops between the shoulders, heavy and defeated.

links.title: You: ""No time for lectures. The point is..."
links.text: "No time for lectures. The point is: you're losing at her nasty mind games. Sylvie's a total *psycho*."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""God... does it mean you talked to..."
links.text: "God... does it mean you talked to her? What else did she say about me?"

links.title: You: "(Just drill the inside of your mout..."
links.text: (Just drill the inside of your mouth with your tongue.)

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Huh?""
links.text: "Huh?"

links.title: Empathy: "Yeah. This feels right. It feels *w..."
links.text: Yeah. This feels right. It feels *wise*. Good setup. Now speak the real shit.

links.title: You: "But... I don't want to *lay* that o..."
links.text: But... I don't want to *lay* that on him.

links.title: Empathy: "Of course you do. This was your pla..."
links.text: Of course you do. This was your plan all along. *This* is how you *fix* it for them -- by answering the *woman question*.

links.title: Volition: "Uhm... I don't like this. There doe..."
links.text: Uhm... I don't like this. There doesn't seem to be another way.

links.title: You: "Don't I have anything else? Like a..."
links.text: Don't I have anything else? Like a *BACK* button for example?

links.title: Empathy: "Life doesn't have a *BACK* button...."
links.text: Life doesn't have a *BACK* button. Now get off your ass and speak the truth about Sylvie the Whore.

links.title: You: ""I talked to Sylvie. She left becau..."
links.text: "I talked to Sylvie. She left because of me, not you."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Wait, what?" He looks up, surprise..."
links.text: "Wait, what?" He looks up, surprised. "But what about the bird?"

links.title: You: ""The bird?""
links.text: "The bird?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Yes, the bird. I found it lying on..."
links.text: "Yes, the bird. I found it lying on the floor with a broken wing the morning she left."

links.title: You: ""She didn't break it, I did. I thre..."
links.text: "She didn't break it, I did. I threw it against the wall."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""*You* broke the skua?!" His face i..."
links.text: "*You* broke the skua?!" His face is flushed with emotions. A rash covers his neck.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I assure you, it was him.""
links.text: "I assure you, it was him."

links.title: Empathy: "It's as if he can't decide whether..."
links.text: It's as if he can't decide whether to be angry or relieved that it was you -- again.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Why on Earth did you have to break..."
links.text: "Why on Earth did you have to break the skua?!"

links.title: You: ""It's a mystery.""
links.text: "It's a mystery."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""I can't believe it... I was so sur..."
links.text: "I can't believe it... I was so sure it was Sylvie. Even worse, I thought she was trying to send me a *message*. Symbol of hope and all..."

links.title: Conceptualization: "A tender type of hope. Something st..."
links.text: A tender type of hope. Something stirs in you... perhaps this is why *you* broke it?

links.title: Half Light: "That bird ain't no symbol of hope...."
links.text: That bird ain't no symbol of hope. It's a menace and a traitor!

links.title: You: ""You tell me.""
links.text: "You tell me."

links.title: You: ""I just break things. It's the way..."
links.text: "I just break things. It's the way I am."

links.title: You: ""Maybe I have a vendetta against it?""
links.text: "Maybe I have a vendetta against it?"

links.title: You: ""She said it was a just an accident.""
links.text: "She said it was a just an accident."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Why didn't she just *tell* me that..."
links.text: "Why didn't she just *tell* me that?! I don't care about stuffed birds, I care about my employees..." He stumbles with words, shaking his head.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Alright." He calms himself. "Did s..."
links.text: "Alright." He calms himself. "Did she say anything else? About me, you know." He repeats: "Did she say anything about *me*?"

links.title: You: ""She said she was flattered -- it w..."
links.text: "She said she was flattered -- it was just a bad timing."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Really? I should... I should give..."
links.text: "Really? I should... I should give her a call then." The man doesn't know what to say. He wipes his brow and stares at the counter.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Thanks, I guess..." He gives you a..."
links.text: "Thanks, I guess..." He gives you a short nod. "Was there anything else you wanted, or..."

links.title: Suggestion: "...or can you give him a moment? So..."
links.text: ...or can you give him a moment? Somehow you realize this is not going to net you any *professional discounts*. Already he's reverting back to defensive.

links.title: Hand/Eye Coordination: "We were sort of hoping there would..."
links.text: We were sort of hoping there would be a gun, an expensive jewel, or at least a *sword* in it for you -- if you deliver the message. Oh well...

links.title: You: ""She said you're nice. But also her..."
links.text: "She said you're nice. But also her employer. I mean, c'mon. The power vertical here..." (Shake your head.)

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Yeah... I do have a lot of cafeter..."
links.text: "Yeah... I do have a lot of cafeterias to manage. And a lot of employees there. I can't make this part of my work practice, it was... unprofessional of me."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Anyway -- thank you for clearing i..."
links.text: "Anyway -- thank you for clearing it up. Now, if there isn't anything else..." He does not seem to be overjoyed about his new-found professionalism.

links.title: You: ""No, we didn't really talk about yo..."
links.text: "No, we didn't really talk about you."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""I see." It's clear he's disappoint..."
links.text: "I see." It's clear he's disappointed. "Well, thank you for the intel anyway. Shame about the bird."

links.title: You: ""Garte, I found a new bird... dammi..."
links.text: "Garte, I found a new bird... dammit, I FORGOT to take it with me!"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""I have no idea what you're talking..."
links.text: "I have no idea what you're talking about."

links.title: Endurance: "It's a long *healthy* trek back to..."
links.text: It's a long *healthy* trek back to the village.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "Back to the village -- then back he..."
links.text: Back to the village -- then back here -- then back to the coast *again*... That must be 3 kilometres in total. Okay...

links.title: You: ""Garte, I found a new bird for the..."
links.text: "Garte, I found a new bird for the Whirling." (Give him the ruffed grouse.)

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""What is this thing?" The man takes..."
links.text: "What is this thing?" The man takes the stuffed bird.

links.title: You: ""It's no biggie. I just thought it..."
links.text: "It's no biggie. I just thought it would look nice on the wall. I'm that kind of cop."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""What -- the interior-decorating ki..."
links.text: "What -- the interior-decorating kind?" He inspects the bird, somewhat suspiciously -- then mellows. "You know -- I'm sorry. This is actually a nice bird. A competent piece of taxidermy."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""I can fix it to the plaque and hav..."
links.text: "I can fix it to the plaque and have a... new bird in the establishment I guess?" He hesitates. "So, I don't know... thank you? I'm gonna go with *thank you*."

links.title: Empathy: "People just don't know how to accep..."
links.text: People just don't know how to accept gifts, especially taxidermy. He likes it. He likes the bird. It solves his broken bird problem.

links.title: Endurance: "This was mostly about the fucking *..."
links.text: This was mostly about the fucking *cardio*. Massive cardio here. You'll live 'til 90! *Or* you'll get a heart attack from running.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I feel good about our work here to..."
links.text: "I feel good about our work here today." The lieutenant nods. "It's all about the little things -- like bringing people random stuffed animals."

links.title: Rhetoric: "It's.... not actually about that. B..."
links.text: It's.... not actually about that. But he liked it.

links.title: You: ""I wanted to apologize for breaking..."
links.text: "I wanted to apologize for breaking the great skua -- by bringing you this ruffed grouse."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Okay..." He inspects the bird, som..."
links.text: "Okay..." He inspects the bird, somewhat suspiciously -- then mellows. "Okay. Well. This is actually a nice bird. A competent piece of taxidermy."

links.title: You: ""It was actually me who broke the g..."
links.text: "It was actually me who broke the great skua. I wanted to apologize by bringing you this ruffed grouse."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""I should have known Sylvie wouldn'..."
links.text: "I should have known Sylvie wouldn't *accidentally* break things here..." He inspects the bird, somewhat suspiciously -- then mellows. "Okay. This is actually a nice bird. A competent piece of taxidermy."

links.title: You: ""This is the ruffed grouse. It symb..."
links.text: "This is the ruffed grouse. It symbolizes the might of male courtship rituals. May it serve as a reminder -- to keep an eye on the cock-carouseliers."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Cool. Okay." He inspects the bird...."
links.text: "Cool. Okay." He inspects the bird. "I was really hoping *not* to think about the cock carousel any longer, because it made me feel like *shit* -- but this *is* a competent piece of taxidermy."

links.title: You: ""I have the tape now. You *have* to..."
links.text: "I have the tape now. You *have* to let me sing karaoke." (Give him the tape)

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "The man in the vest and the violet..."
links.text: The man in the vest and the violet shirt stares at the tape you've just given him. He begins to frown. Hard.

links.title: Authority: "This is the look of a man who's *de..."
links.text: This is the look of a man who's *defeated*. He knows he's out of excuses.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Fine. Fine. Climb on that stage an..."
links.text: "Fine. Fine. Climb on that stage and do your thing, just get out of my hair." He shakes the tape at you. "I'll plug it in for you. Damn this karaoke machine..."

links.title: Perception (Hearing): ""I'm having it uninstalled," he mum..."
links.text: "I'm having it uninstalled," he mumbles to himself.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Oh yeah. Time to do the damage."
links.text: Oh yeah. Time to do the damage.

links.text: "Fine. Fine. *After* you've paid your bills you can climb that stage and do whatever the hell you need to do. *After*." He shakes the tape at you. "Damn this karaoke machine..."

links.title: You: ""Garte, I need to sing karaoke now.""
links.text: "Garte, I need to sing karaoke now."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""No, you *don't*.""
links.text: "No, you *don't*."

links.title: Composure: "He tries not to look at you -- it's..."
links.text: He tries not to look at you -- it's dangerous to *acknowledge* the karaoke man.

links.title: Rhetoric: "You need to approach this situation..."
links.text: You need to approach this situation logically. Ask him why he has the PA system installed, if you can't use it.

links.title: You: ""Yeah, but..." (Look him in the eye..."
links.text: "Yeah, but..." (Look him in the eye) "Johnny Law is about to tear it up sad-style."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""The Whirling doesn't need more *sa..."
links.text: "The Whirling doesn't need more *sad style*. That's one of the styles it can do without right now."

links.title: You: ""Why do you even have the PA system..."
links.text: "Why do you even have the PA system if no one's going to use it?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""It's for the..." He begins confide..."
links.text: "It's for the..." He begins confidently, but then stumbles on his own words. "It's for no one. It's a prop. I'm not letting anyone use it after the Great Karaoke Catastrophe of '44."

links.title: You: ""What happened in '44?""
links.text: "What happened in '44?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""A lot of people got killed because..."
links.text: "A lot of people got killed because some asshole wanted to sing karaoke."

links.title: You: ""It's not a prop. It's for your cli..."
links.text: "It's not a prop. It's for your clients. I know it's used."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Okay, yes, it's for *some* clients..."
links.text: "Okay, yes, it's for *some* clients," he admits reluctantly.

links.title: You: ""I'm a real client, I've paid my bi..."
links.text: "I'm a real client, I've paid my bills and I have the right to use the karaoke machine."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Hah! Well!" He comes up with a cou..."
links.text: "Hah! Well!" He comes up with a counterargument. "We don't have any tapes. They all got stolen."

links.title: Drama: "He's lying. But whatever, you don't..."
links.text: He's lying. But whatever, you don't really *need* his lame tracks.

links.title: You: ""It's all right, I have my own song..."
links.text: "It's all right, I have my own song with me." (Give him the tape for "Smallest Church in Saint-Saëns".)

links.title: Drama: "He's lying... But there's no way to..."
links.text: He's lying... But there's no way to call him out on it.

links.title: You: ""Oh no.... I don't have my tape wit..."
links.text: "Oh no.... I don't have my tape with me either."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Oh, that's so sad to hear," he say..."
links.text: "Oh, that's so sad to hear," he says with a barely disguised grin. "I'd *totally* let you sing karaoke, if you only had a tape."

links.title: Suggestion: "Wait, why don't you have a song?! W..."
links.text: Wait, why don't you have a song?! Way to fuck it up! Better to try this line of questioning again after you've found the tape.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Oh, that's so sad to hear," he say..."
links.text: "Oh, that's so sad to hear," he says with a barely disguised grin. "I'd *totally* let you sing karaoke, if you only had a tape -- *and* you'd paid your bills."

links.title: You: ""Okay, *fuck* me then! Just FUCK me!""
links.text: "Okay, *fuck* me then! Just FUCK me!"

links.text: "Stop yelling."

links.text: "I'm a client. Why can't I use it?"

links.text: "You're a *bad* client. You haven't paid your bills yet."

links.text: "So -- after I've paid my bills, can I use the karaoke carousel?"

links.text: "Technically -- okay, yes. But we don't have any tapes. They all got stolen."

links.title: You: ""When was the last time you had a b..."
links.text: "When was the last time you had a band play here?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""It's not for bands, it's for clien..."
links.text: "It's not for bands, it's for clients. *Some* clients, okay? Not you."

links.title: You: ""It's part of my quest of self-disc..."
links.text: "It's part of my quest of self-discovery. Help me."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""The Whirling's not a charity or a..."
links.text: "The Whirling's not a charity or a musical therapy clinic, it's a commercial establishment. You're going to scare away the customers."

links.title: You: ""This is my way of apologizing for..."
links.text: "This is my way of apologizing for the trouble I've caused. Please let me say I'm sorry."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""By causing more trouble? I think w..."
links.text: "By causing more trouble? I think we're good."

links.title: You: ""You're right, it's not the right t..."
links.text: "You're right, it's not the right time yet."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""There never *will* be a right time..."
links.text: "There never *will* be a right time, believe me. That karaoke system is only there for show. I'm not going to let *anyone* use it anymore."

links.title: You: ""By the way, I'm going to sing kara..."
links.text: "By the way, I'm going to sing karaoke here."

links.text: "Absolutely out of the question."

links.title: Volition: "You wait and see, cafeteria manager..."
links.text: You wait and see, cafeteria manager!

links.title: Inland Empire: "Absolutely *in* the question! First..."
links.text: Absolutely *in* the question! First we find a *sad* banger, then we sing this place to SHIT.

links.title: Drama: "Your body is ready, sire."
links.text: Your body is ready, sire.

links.text: "Good bye." [Leave.]

dialogueTree.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Oh, you're up." He looks you over...."
dialogueTree.text: "Oh, you're up." He looks you over. "It's good to see you back on your feet. Did you like your room? I cleaned it for you."

links.title: Cuno: ""Fucking cleaned it..." He hisses s..."
links.text: "Fucking cleaned it..." He hisses something under his breath.

links.text: Cuno forces an unnatural smile.

links.title: You: ""I did, thank you. Big improvement.""
links.text: "I did, thank you. Big improvement."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""You're welcome. I thought it would..."
links.text: "You're welcome. I thought it would be nice for you to wake up in a clean place after you -- let's be fair -- defended this establishment and its clientèle from gunfire."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""I give credit where credit is due..."
links.text: "I give credit where credit is due and that, sir -- was a nice shot. I was watching until you hit him, crawled inside then. Bullets started flying. Anyway..." He clears his throat.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""I give credit where credit is due..."
links.text: "I give credit where credit is due and that, sir -- was an honest effort. I was watching until it *went* down. Crawled inside then. Bullets started flying. Anyway..." He clears his throat.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""I give credit where credit is due..."
links.text: "I give credit where credit is due and that was a crazy move -- crazy *effective*. Petroleum bomb, never seen anything like that... I was there until it struck him, crawled inside then. Bullets started flying. Anyway..." He clears his throat.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""'Defended' may be putting it a bit..."
links.text: "'Defended' may be putting it a bit generously, though. I had a great view of you doing *nothing* to stop those psychopaths. Then I crawled inside. Bullets started flying. Anyway..." He clears his throat.

links.title: You: ""It could have used more work. Afte..."
links.text: "It could have used more work. After all, I just took a bullet for this place."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Really *cool* man -- yeah." His po..."
links.text: "Really *cool* man -- yeah." His posture changes immediately. "Entitlement. Everybody likes that -- everybody likes an entitled person who doesn't know how to say thank you."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""You know, I was *about* to congrat..."
links.text: "You know, I was *about* to congratulate you on your great aim, but seeing as you're already so special -- I'm not going to. Someone has to be *pedagogical* around here."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""I hope at least your partner is re..."
links.text: "I hope at least your partner is recovering quickly. Also!" He wags his finger. "You're staying here for *free* now. That's right. This establishment supports cops. Even cops like you."

links.title: Authority: "He thinks it weak to renege on the..."
links.text: He thinks it weak to renege on the courtesy he already decided to pay you. Moral superiority is important to him.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Thank you, sir. And he appreciated..."
links.text: "Thank you, sir. And he appreciated the clean room, by the way. He just likes to act like he doesn't."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Well, anyway..." The man clears hi..."
links.text: "Well, anyway..." The man clears his throat, not knowing what to say.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Also!" He wags his finger. "You an..."
links.text: "Also!" He wags his finger. "You and your partner are staying here *free* now. I'm not gonna let you ruin it for him. This establishment supports cops. Even cops like you."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""You know, I was *about* to congrat..."
links.text: "You know, I was *about* to congratulate you on your great aim -- but seeing as you're so special already, I'm going to tell you the truth instead. You missed. And you suck. It was an awful shot."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""You know, I was *about* to not men..."
links.text: "You know, I was *about* to not mention the petroleum bomb you used -- to grill that man alive -- but since you're a psychopath anyway. Fuck it. Nice grilling. Insane, but effective."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""You know, I was *about* to not men..."
links.text: "You know, I was *about* to not mention the clown circus you did out there -- throwing petroleum bombs and whatnot -- but since you feel entitled to nice things, here's the truth: you sucked. It was reckless."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Especially when you're so busy doi..."
links.text: "Especially when you're so busy doing *nothing* to stop psychopaths. How could you just stand there? Still, you did risk your life..."

links.title: You: ""You did? I was too distracted to n..."
links.text: "You did? I was too distracted to notice..."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Oh?" His posture changes immediate..."
links.text: "Oh?" His posture changes immediately. "So cool. Cool-cop strikes again. Well -- I didn't expect someone in *your line of work* to notice the lowly efforts of *the service industry* anyway, so..."

dialogueTree.text: "Ah, 'Smallest Church in Saint-Saëns,' right?" The cafeteria manager is waiting for you to acknowledge that he recognized the song.

links.text: "Cool." He really does sound like he thinks it's a little *cool*. "Now, what can I do for you?"

links.text: "Yeah. The Church is actually my *life*."

links.text: "I fucking rocked that shit."

links.text: "It was all right." He doesn't sound like he thinks you *rocked* it. "Subdued. I might start letting people up there again... Now, what can I do for you?"

links.text: "Told you I'd rock that shit."

dialogueTree.text: "Wow." He starts a slow clap. "Just wow. I hope you really enjoyed yourself up there -- had a *cathartic* experience. Because for the rest of us..."

links.text: "...that really *sucked*."
