links.text: It's safe to say this is about your karaoke performance.

links.title: You: ""Fuck you, I have a *vast* soul and..."
links.text: "Fuck you, I have a *vast* soul and she will always come back to it."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Good for you. I'm not letting *any..."
links.text: "Good for you. I'm not letting *anyone* up there again -- ever. Now what did you want?"

links.title: Inland Empire: "You feel bad suddenly. You see the..."
links.text: You feel bad suddenly. You see the delicate loops of the handwriting, in your mind's eye.

links.title: Inland Empire: "What was that? Who's the *she*? And..."
links.text: What was that? Who's the *she*? And why do you feel so *bad' suddenly...

links.title: You: ""Yeah, I sucked up there. I'm sorry.""
links.text: "Yeah, I sucked up there. I'm sorry."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Good. It's good you're sorry. I'm..."
links.text: "Good. It's good you're sorry. I'm not letting *anyone* up there anymore. Now what did you want?"

links.title: You: ""You don't *understand* my performa..."
links.text: "You don't *understand* my performance. Those high notes? I purposefully shredded them to convey a strained, worn out sadness."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""I get it. You were *purposefully*..."
links.text: "I get it. You were *purposefully* shit. So original. I'm not letting *anyone* up there again -- ever. Now what did you want?"

links.title: You: ""Forget about that, I had something.""
links.text: "Forget about that, I had something."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""How can I forget about it?" He sto..."
links.text: "How can I forget about it?" He stops the slow clap. "It was *unforgettable*..."

dialogueTree.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Real mature, man. What exactly wer..."
dialogueTree.text: "Real mature, man. What exactly were you trying to accomplish?" He crosses his arms. "You do understand you still owe me money, right?"

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Damn! Your feet thought we got away..."
links.text: Damn! Your feet thought we got away!

links.title: Volition: "That doesn't seem fair. You demonst..."
links.text: That doesn't seem fair. You demonstrated some serious skills there, slipping away Sam Bo-style.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "By the way, Sam Bo or Samaran boxin..."
links.text: By the way, Sam Bo or Samaran boxing is an eloquently violent set of one-on-one fighting moves originating from the Samaran isola. Sam Bo used to incorporate a wide array of martial disciplines from archery to mounted combat, but mainly means aesthetically pleasing single combat nowadays. *Sam Bo style* implies stealth, cleverness, and cool.

links.title: You: ""Hold on -- what is this *money* an..."
links.text: "Hold on -- what is this *money* anyway?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""What are you, a philosopher?""
links.text: "What are you, a philosopher?"

links.title: You: ""Actually, I might be.""
links.text: "Actually, I might be."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Money is what grown up people use..."
links.text: "Money is what grown up people use to pay for things. Things like this hostel room or..." He peeks into the ledger: "...or eight bottles of 'Potent Blend' and nine packs of 'Royal Extra'. We use it for everything, really."

links.title: You: ""Where can I get money?""
links.text: "Where can I get money?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Are you serious? From your work, I..."
links.text: "Are you serious? From your work, I don't know... you can take bribes, I guess." He looks at lieutenant. "I'm sorry. I don't think cops take bribes."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Some do take recompense." The lieu..."
links.text: "Some do take recompense." The lieutenant is dead serious. "But only to survive."

links.title: You: ""Why do I need it?""
links.text: "Why do I need it?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""For survival, to pay *me*. Unless..."
links.text: "For survival, to pay *me*. Unless you want to become a *hobo*? Do you want to become a hobo? There's nowhere else to stay in Martinaise and it's a cold spring outside. Money doesn't make you happy but it lets you be *un*happy for a bit longer."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""If you run out of money, you die...."
links.text: "If you run out of money, you die. It's like that for all of us -- me too. That's why I need you to pay me." He stops and says, mostly to himself: "I'm not an asshole."

links.title: You: ""But what if I don't have any?""
links.text: "But what if I don't have any?"
There's a shuffle of nylon as Lieutenant Kitsuragi looks for something in the pockets of his orange bomber.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "That's cop for: "I haven't offered..."
links.text: That's cop for: "I haven't offered to pay because I don't have any money either."

links.title: You: "(Proceed -- show him the coins you..."
links.text: (Proceed -- show him the coins you found) "I think I might have some."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Yeah, that's not enough.""
links.text: "Yeah, that's not enough."

links.title: You: ""How so, isn't this the IIR? There'..."
links.text: "How so, isn't this the IIR? There's like forty of them!" (Give them to him.)

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""No, you see..." There's a tinge of..."
links.text: "No, you see..." There's a tinge of sadness in his voice. "That's 40 *cents*. Cents are a form of currency one hundred times smaller than the reál. I'm not even going to take this. Come back when you have 130 reál."

links.title: You: ""One *hundred* times smaller?""
links.text: "One *hundred* times smaller?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Yes.""
links.text: "Yes."

links.title: You: ""But that's horrible.""
links.text: "But that's horrible."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""It is." He stands silently looking..."
links.text: "It is." He stands silently looking at the coins on the counter.

links.title: Suggestion: "For a moment, his antipathy is over..."
links.text: For a moment, his antipathy is overcome by compassion for the sheer smallness of the money.

links.title: Conceptualization: "Isn't it... evil? The order of magn..."
links.text: Isn't it... evil? The order of magnitude between what is asked of a person -- and what they have?

links.title: You: ""Darkness rides." (Pick up the coin..."
links.text: "Darkness rides." (Pick up the coins.)

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""It does, doesn't it.""
links.text: "It does, doesn't it."

links.title: You: "Keep it to yourself and pick up the..."
links.text: Keep it to yourself and pick up the coins.

links.title: You: "Pick up the coins."
links.text: Pick up the coins.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "He demonstratively suppresses a wor..."
links.text: He demonstratively suppresses a world-weary sigh.

links.title: You: ""Okay.""
links.text: "Okay."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "He stands silently looking at the c..."
links.text: He stands silently looking at the coins on the counter.

links.title: You: "(Keep the money.)"
links.text: (Keep the money.)

links.title: You: "(Proceed -- show him the coins you..."
links.text: (Proceed -- show him the coins you found) "Is this money?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Yes. It is.""
links.text: "Yes. It is."

links.title: You: "(Count them and give them to him.)..."
links.text: (Count them and give them to him.) "That's 10 plus 10 plus 20 equals 40. I'm now down by 40, right?"

links.title: You: "Keep the money."
links.text: Keep the money.

links.title: You: "(Proceed -- don't show him the coin..."
links.text: (Proceed -- don't show him the coins you found.)

links.title: You: ""I don't think I have *any* money."..."
links.text: "I don't think I have *any* money." (Proceed.)

links.title: You: ""Since I woke up I have trouble rem..."
links.text: "Since I woke up I have trouble remembering even the most basic concepts of reality."

links.title: You: ""No, I'm just getting my bearings.""
links.text: "No, I'm just getting my bearings."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""What are you, brain-damaged?""
links.text: "What are you, brain-damaged?"

links.title: You: ""But you must have appreciated my S..."
links.text: "But you must have appreciated my Sam Bo style stealth."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Oh, well, if that was *Sam Bo* sty..."
links.text: "Oh, well, if that was *Sam Bo* style, then let me wipe that debt, sir!" he snorts sarcastically, then suddenly changes tone, probably realizing it *was* pretty cool.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Okay, the stupid drinks are on the..."
links.text: "Okay, the stupid drinks are on the house, Mr. Athlete. I still have to charge you for three nights and the broken window -- that's 100 square."

links.title: You: ""That window was just an unfortunat..."
links.text: "That window was just an unfortunate casualty of me practising my moves. I won't pay for it."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Fine, I'll take it off the bill! S..."
links.text: "Fine, I'll take it off the bill! Sleep in a post-apocalyptic hell-hole if you want to. Just know I won't give you another room."

links.title: You: ""So we're cool?""
links.text: "So we're cool?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Not *entirely* cool. You still owe..."
links.text: "Not *entirely* cool. You still owe me 60 reál for three nights stay. If you don't have it by tonight, I can't let you back up there..." He points upstairs, toward your room.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Now what the hell did you want? I..."
links.text: "Now what the hell did you want? I assume you *wanted* something to come back here..."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Not *entirely* cool. You still owe..."
links.text: "Not *entirely* cool. You still owe me 100 reál. If you don't have it by tonight, I can't let you back up there..." He points upstairs, toward your room.

links.title: You: ""Thank you for your cooperation.""
links.text: "Thank you for your cooperation."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Don't thank me yet. You still owe..."
links.text: "Don't thank me yet. You still owe me 60 reál for three nights stay. If you don't have it by tonight, I can't let you up there..." He points upstairs, toward your room.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Don't thank me yet. You still owe..."
links.text: "Don't thank me yet. You still owe me 100 reál. If you don't have it by tonight, I can't let you up there..." He points upstairs, toward your room.

links.title: You: ""You didn't appreciate my moves?""
links.text: "You didn't appreciate my moves?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""You know what? The stupid drinks y..."
links.text: "You know what? The stupid drinks you've had are on the house. You know why? Because I *know* you can't pay for them. *Not* because you ran away."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "He crosses his arms: "Now. I still..."
links.text: He crosses his arms: "Now. I still have to charge you for three nights and the broken window -- that's 100 square."

links.title: You: ""Don't I get something for effort?""
links.text: "Don't I get something for effort?"

links.title: You: ""I'm sorry, I know it was irrespons..."
links.text: "I'm sorry, I know it was irresponsible of me to run. You have to understand -- I was desperate."

dialogueTree.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Hey." He nods in greeting. "Was th..."
dialogueTree.text: "Hey." He nods in greeting. "Was there something you needed?"

links.title: Suggestion: "Well, well, bringing him that new b..."
links.text: Well, well, bringing him that new bird sure made a difference in his attitude.

dialogueTree.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Can I help you?" He arches an eyeb..."
dialogueTree.text: "Can I help you?" He arches an eyebrow.

links.title: Half Light: "That fucking smug asshole, he knows..."
links.text: That fucking smug asshole, he knows you've been locked out of your room. He's probably laughing at you now on the inside.

links.title: You: ""Are you laughing at me?""
links.text: "Are you laughing at me?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""...what?""
links.text: "...what?"

links.title: Half Light: "Good. He's getting scared now. Pret..."
links.text: Good. He's getting scared now. Pretending he doesn't know what you're talking about. Don't let him get away with it.

links.title: You: ""You smarmy asshole, you're not goi..."
links.text: "You smarmy asshole, you're not going to get away with this. No one laughs at The Law!"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Do I *look* like I'm laughing? Do..."
links.text: "Do I *look* like I'm laughing? Do you see a *smile* on my face? I know what this is about. This is about the electronic lock not letting you in your room -- and it's anything but *funny* to me."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""You know why? Because *unpaid bill..."
links.text: "You know why? Because *unpaid bills* are not funny, when you have to run *four* service establishments." He folds his arms in a huff. "Now. We can talk about a *solution* to this problem."

links.title: You: ""What? What?" (Mock his confusion)"
links.text: "What? What?" (Mock his confusion)

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""This is about your room being lock..."
links.text: "This is about your room being locked, isn't it? It's about the electronic lock?" He cuts right through it, with his smarmy know-it-all attitude. "Unpaid bills are no laughing matter to me, sir. I *assure* you."

links.title: Composure: "He trembled just a little as he ass..."
links.text: He trembled just a little as he assumed this position. You've made him nervous, though he doesn't want to show it.

links.title: Half Light: "Look at that cum-stain son of a bit..."
links.text: Look at that cum-stain son of a bitch. He's just begging to be laid out on the floor of this *establishment*.

links.title: Logic: "Relax. Knocking out the cafeteria m..."
links.text: Relax. Knocking out the cafeteria manager is not going to solve your lodging problem, not in the long run.

links.title: You: "No. I don't want to get angry."
links.text: No. I don't want to get angry.

links.title: Half Light: "WHAT THE FUCK? He's *laughing* at y..."
links.text: WHAT THE FUCK? He's *laughing* at you trying to not get angry right now -- GET ANGRY.

dialogueTree.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""I give credit where credit is due..."
dialogueTree.text: "I give credit where credit is due and that -- was crazy. To throw a petroleum bomb at him and then *miss*. Maybe not super effective, but very *crazy*. I was watching until that, then crawled inside. Bullets started flying. Anyway..." He clears his throat.

links.title: Suggestion: "He really wants you to realize that..."
links.text: He really wants you to realize that he was also on the balcony looking by. In the *danger* zone, so to say.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""I hope at least your partner is re..."
links.text: "I hope at least your partner is recovering quickly. Also!" He raises his finger. "You're staying here for free now. That's right, this establishment supports cops. The stay is free -- the drinks are not," he adds. "Just felt I needed to specify that."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""I wish you a quick recovery. Also!..."
links.text: "I wish you a quick recovery. Also!" He raises his finger. "You and your partner are staying here free now. This establishment supports cops. The stay is free -- the drinks are not," he adds. "Just felt I needed to specify that."
